title: NFT Artist Brian Frye Wants You to Steal This Article
body:
Brian Frye, a conceptual artist, film maker and law professor, encourages people to plagiarize everything heâ€™s ever created or said.

â€œIâ€™m the legal academyâ€™s leading plagiarism advocate. Iâ€™m also the legal academyâ€™s only plagiarism advocate, which makes it very easy to be number one,â€ the bespectacled Frye said in a video call yesterday. Well, professor, Iâ€™m stealing that joke.

***This article is part of CoinDeskâ€™s [Policy Week,](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/18/crypto-2022-policy-week/) a forum for discussing how regulators are reckoning with crypto (and vice versa). A version of it published first in The Node newsletter, which you can subscribe to***[ ](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters)**[here](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters).**

0 seconds of 2 minutes, 9 secondsVolume 90%

Â 

This pro-plagiarism stance is part of Fryeâ€™s continuing campaign against copyright, the legal instantiation of the idea that ideas can and should be owned. Over the past decade and a half, Frye has written countless legal reviews and op-eds discussing how copyright is antiquated in a world where the internet eliminates the costs associated with reproduction and distribution.

â€œIdeas are non-rival,â€ he told CoinDesk. â€œYou donâ€™t need to value them because thereâ€™s no scarcity, so they should be valueless.â€

This contrarian opinion has brought him to the world of [non-fungible tokens](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2021/02/01/what-are-nfts-and-how-do-they-work/) (NFT), the blockchain-based technology often credited with bringing â€œscarcityâ€ to digital goods. Itâ€™s an idea for which lots of people are willing to pay big bucks.

A representative example: [Ether Rocks](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2021/08/31/why-everyone-in-nfts-is-suddenly-talking-about-price-floors/) is a series of virtual pet rocks that â€œliveâ€ on the Ethereum blockchain. There are 100 unique tokens â€“ each corresponding to a near-identical cartoon JPEG â€“ that even the creators say serve â€œNO PURPOSEâ€ beyond speculation. Though the original image was a royalty-free piece of clip art, some people have spent millions of dollars on these tokens.

But, as Frye notes, what people are buying when they buy any NFT is â€œworthless.â€ By and large, NFTs do not represent ownership of the digital goods to which they supposedly correspond, do not confer copyright and may, in fact, one day be [classified as securities](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/20/some-nfts-are-probably-illegal-does-the-sec-care/). â€œSo the owner of the NFT gets nothing other than the right to claim ownership of the NFT,â€ he [wrote](https://www.americanbar.org/groups/young_lawyers/publications/tyl/topics/poplaw/money-for-nothing-art-for-free-are-nfts-illegal/#:\~:text=So%20the%20owner%20of%20the,the%20artwork%20it%20nominally%20represents.&text=In%20any%20case%2C%20the%20owner,others%20to%20exhibit%20the%20work.) in August.

Thatâ€™s not nothing. In fact, Frye is learning NFTs have a lot going for them. For one, thereâ€™s a sort of community-wide acceptance that people can sell even things they donâ€™t possess. He sold an NFT of the Brooklyn Bridge for [$500](https://mintable.app/collectibles/item/Brooklyn-Bridge-I-have-a-bridge-to-sell-you/EDju7z5Kuhh0M-o) â€“ stealing the idea from an infamous scam artist.

NFTs are the â€œreductio ad absurdumâ€ of contemporary art markets, meaning they reduce the â€œconcept of ownership to its purest essence, itâ€™s the ownership of ownership,â€ he said, and of art to pure market functions. Art, he said, has always been more about status than anything, and the blockchain just makes this pecking order more visible and open.

Further, NFTs are a sort of blunt instrument to wield against legacy institutions. In September, Frye minted a series of NFTs tied to a paper he wrote called â€œ[SEC No-Action Letter Request](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3501251),â€ which raised the question of whether selling shares of ownership in the paper is an illegal unregistered security.

There was the implicit promise of income, which, to his surprise, actually came through. He brought in tens of thousands of dollars worth of ETH in the sale. This proved his thesis: The project called into question standing securities law, which Frye thinks is overly broad in covering â€œany investment in a common enterprise that generates profit from the efforts of others,â€ and lays out a possible argument the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) could use against him.

***Read more: [Some NFTs Are Probably Illegal. Does the SEC Care?](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/20/some-nfts-are-probably-illegal-does-the-sec-care/)***

Itâ€™s easy to call everything meaningless: art, securities rules, copyright. As part of a series weâ€™ve called â€œGensler for a Day,â€ which is asking informed and influential people to give their ideal crypto policies, CoinDesk reached out to see if Frye has any concrete plans, not just concepts. Itâ€™s not too far out there: Frye did once [run](https://twitter.com/brianlfrye/status/1211834713754755073) for public office.

What follows is a condensed version of our conversation, covering NFTs, the SEC and the merits of writing while taking a bath. You can read a full version on [CoinDesk.com](http://coindesk.com/). And feel free to steal his ideas.

**â€œBreak a contemporary museum into pieces with the means you have chosen, collect the pieces and put them together again with glue.â€ \[Thatâ€™s a line from Yoko Onoâ€™s poetry book â€œGrapefruit,â€ which Frye has cited as inspiration.\] Does that mean anything to you?**

The idea is to just give people something to think about when they think about what theyâ€™re doing and why theyâ€™re doing it, you know, and also to do it by kind of ostentatiously plagiarizing someone else at the same time. All my good ideas are stolen from someone else.

Is that what youâ€™re doing with NFTs? I mean, I think so. Iâ€™m not sure what Iâ€™m doing in NFTs, yet. When the NFT thing first hit the public consciousness over the summer, somebody called me from Business Insider and wanted me to talk about what was going on. The first thing I said to her was, â€œI have no idea whatâ€™s happening, but I love it.â€ Thatâ€™s still true, I have no idea whatâ€™s happening. I donâ€™t think anyone has any idea whatâ€™s happening, but something is happening. Iâ€™m just trying to do my best to be open to whatever it is thatâ€™s taking place enough to help me see even though I canâ€™t figure out what it is.

**Are you purposefully goading the SEC to make a determination?**

They wonâ€™t talk to me, they donâ€™t want to talk to me, theyâ€™re terrified of what Iâ€™m asking them. This is existential for the SEC.

**What do you mean by that?**

OK, look, everyone asks the wrong question. People keep saying, â€œis it a security?â€ If the SEC wants to regulate it â€“ thatâ€™s the only real question. The SEC transforms things into securities by the magic of regulation. Anything can be a security as long as the SEC decides to characterize it as a security because the definition is overinclusive, it means everything.

I donâ€™t mean Iâ€™m agnostic as to how we should go about doing this. Maybe a probationary regime of securities regulation is what we want. Maybe we do want a kind of SEC exercising discretion about what it regulates. But the problem is the SEC. The people there are morons. They have no idea what theyâ€™re doing and they donâ€™t actually realize that the term â€œsecurityâ€ is meaningless.

So this is a problem for them because all of a sudden theyâ€™re confronted with something that is terribly, existentially terrifying to them because they donâ€™t know what to do with it.

**Youâ€™re doing the work for them. They can plagiarize it if they want.**

A friend of mine said to me when I did the SEC â€œNo Actionâ€ letter requests as a work of conceptual art â€“ the conceptual art consisted of me sending the â€œNo Actionâ€ letter request to the SEC asking them to â€œregulate me baby.â€ I explained to them, this is a security according to your definition, therefore you should prohibit me from selling it. My friend said this is probably the first ever â€œActionâ€ letter request. Because nobody sends a letter to the SEC, saying, â€œI want to do something illegal, please stop me.â€

**Youâ€™ve received broad acceptance from the NFT community, from the media â€“ Business Insider, Bloomberg, CoinDesk. But it seems like your true audience â€“ the SEC â€“ has rejected your work. (They could also just move slowly.) How does that make you feel?**

I love it. If the SEC had it in them to respond to what Iâ€™m doing I think it would make the art less fun. The whole point is to be trolling the government. The SEC is basically nerd cops. They want to be in the business of being in charge. The one thing youâ€™re not used to is people punking them. No one does this.

**Except for Elon Musk.**

Fair. Heâ€™s got balls of steel to punk the SEC while having something actually on the line. No one questions whether or not it falls within the sphere of securities regulation. Heâ€™s playing chicken with them. In my case, thereâ€™s no risk. What are they going to do to me? It would be too humiliating for them to prosecute me. Bringing an action against me would be like throwing me in the briar patch.

**You said that a lot of people suddenly wanted to spend a lot of money to buy nothing, because thatâ€™s what an NFT is â€“ nothing. Are your ideas worth less than nothing?**

I mean, ideas are valueless because they donâ€™t need to have a value. Ideas are non-rival. You donâ€™t need to value them because thereâ€™s no scarcity, so they should be valueless. What I find most interesting about NFTs is that they sort of are the reductio ad absurdum of the art world in a really beautiful way.

Everyone talks about Walter Benjamin and the â€œaura of authenticity of the work of art.â€ You know, God bless him, I think he was actually onto something, but he was totally wrong, but it wasnâ€™t his fault that in 100 years thereâ€™d be the internet, let alone cryptocurrency or NFTs. The problem is he saw the aura as being attached to the authentic object; but what he missed, I think, was that the aura is really all about ownership. The concept of ownership. The peculiar thing about NFTs is that they reduce the concept of ownership to its purest essence, itâ€™s the ownership of ownership, and thatâ€™s it.

**Right. You donâ€™t own the object, you own a token that may correspond to an object.**

You own a token that the relevant people are willing to accept as corresponding to ownership of something valuable. Something that they care about, that matters, is meaningful. Itâ€™s all about status, really, itâ€™s about other peopleâ€™s recognition. When you buy art, what youâ€™re buying is a spot in some artistâ€™s catalog or resume â€“ sometimes a dirty piece of cloth or a lumpy rock comes along with it.

***See also: [Itâ€™s Time to Talk About NFTs and Intellectual Property Law](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/03/09/state-of-crypto-its-time-to-talk-about-nfts-and-intellectual-property-law/)***

**Youâ€™re sometimes credited, but not always, with the idea that copyright holders are like landlords. Insisting that an idea has value and then charging a type of tithe for people to use it. Who fixes the drain when something is clogged in this analogy?**

No one! Thatâ€™s part of the problem. Corporate owners are the worst landlords because they donâ€™t do any maintenance, and they think theyâ€™re Godâ€™s gift. Regular landlords at least have a bit of humility. The whole point is not to say that thereâ€™s anything wrong with landlords, itâ€™s just to say that there is something wrong with idolizing copyright owners and authors by association with their ideas. Thereâ€™s nothing special about collecting rent, and thatâ€™s all youâ€™re doing when you assert copyright ownership.

**Do you have thoughts about the idea of copyright in NFTs?**

The beautiful thing about NFTs is that they might actually solve a problem, at least some of the problems, that arise in that landlord scenario. What weâ€™ve done with this technology and various other kinds of internet-based platforms has eliminated entirely all the costs associated with reproducing and distributing works of authorship. That used to be the most expensive part of getting culture out to the public. The whole reason that copyright came into existence in the first place was that the cost of reproduction and distribution had come down slightly when the printing press was invented. When the cost came down a little bit â€“ from manuscripts to printed books â€“ copyright made sense.

The problem is that now the cost of reproduction and distribution is zero. Itâ€™s zero. The only cost is associated with producing the work in the first place, but weâ€™re stuck with the same mechanism designed for a world where transaction costs associated with reproduction and distribution were significant.

My hope is that NFTs have the potential to actually compensate authors without having to have copyright at all. Imagine two different potential worlds: You can have one world where you own the right to control the use of the works of authorship you create â€“ you can tell people what they can and canâ€™t do with whatever it is that you produce. But you donâ€™t really get any money if no one really cares or wants to give you money for it. In the other world you donâ€™t own anything. You have no right to control how people use the work of authorship that you created, but somebody is willing to give you 100 grand for it. Which do you prefer?

Iâ€™m greedy. I want the money, upfront. I donâ€™t give a \[care\] about control. We donâ€™t need control anymore as long as you can get paid up front. And, to my mind, NFTs might make that possible. A lot of people are still stuck in this controlling mindset.

**What are the concrete policy considerations you want to throw on the table? Eliminate copyright?**

I think it has to happen on its own. Iâ€™m not delusional enough to think anyone gives a \[hoot\] what I think. All I can do is throw ideas out there and see what sticks. The landlord thing was great: I put it out there, Mike Masnick picked it up, people ran with it, nobody attributes it to me, but they use it all the time and I love it. It was viral. No oneâ€™s going to listen to me to make copyright policy or any other kind of policy, but if we can shift the window a little bit and help people see that this is something actually positive and potentially liberatory thatâ€™s going to give people an opportunity to get outside of our regime of ownership that is not productive.

**So plagiarism is productive?**

I think creators are very narcissistic and they should get over themselves. I like to say Iâ€™m the legal academyâ€™s leading plagiarism advocate. Iâ€™m also the legal academyâ€™s only plagiarism advocate, which makes it very easy to be number one.

**Why do you write in a bathtub?**

Itâ€™s comfortable. Itâ€™s relaxing. It gives me a little bit of time off. Alan Greenspan used to do it.

**A little Randian in the tub.**

I like to think he would be horrified by everything I stand for.

**Do you still think NFTs have the ability to collapse the traditional art market by siphoning off capital?**

I think yes. I mean, ideally, yes. But I would put it a little bit differently. I think NFTs have the potential to make the traditional art market irrelevant, which will be a wonderful thing because I think that thereâ€™s a fetishization of objects that I think is unhealthy. Taking the money away lets us think about the art more. Art is a consumer good that consumers donâ€™t understand. Consumers understand money â€“ thatâ€™s why we talk about art in terms of money, because that helps people understand it. We talk about law schools in the same way, in rankings. We have stock markets â€“ someone won a Nobel Prize for telling us that price is just a way of communicating information.

**\[Laughs, Googles Joseph E. Stiglitz, cries.\]**

The art market is a way of communicating information about consumer preferences. The problem is consumers donâ€™t actually know what they want to buy. All they know is what the price tells them about what theyâ€™re supposed to buy. What theyâ€™re ultimately buying isnâ€™t the object, itâ€™s the status associated with the object. NFTs make the work available to everyone on the same terms, and make it very clear that what youâ€™re buying and what youâ€™re trading is just the status associated with being the owner.

***See also: [Nobel Laureate Thinks Bitcoin is an â€œAmazingâ€ Bubble](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2014/01/24/nobel-laureate-thinks-bitcoin-is-an-amazing-bubble/)***

**Some notable art critics have said thereâ€™s little aesthetic value in NFT art.**

Most art critics are idiots. Iâ€™m in the process of trolling Chris Knight right now â€“ the least-deserving Pulitzer Prize winner in the history of Pulitzer Prizes. I will concede that what people are trading is in many respects not to my aesthetic preferences. But I donâ€™t think that matters. Who cares what my aesthetic preferences are? If people like it, whoâ€™s to say?

I also think that itâ€™s too early to really know what people are going to ultimately value and find worthwhile, and why theyâ€™re going to value it and find it worthwhile. The wonderful thing about NFTs is we donâ€™t actually need them â€“ theyâ€™re a technical solution to a problem that never actually existed, but we need to figure out how to solve anyway.

title: Bitcoinâ€™s Inflation Narrative More Compelling Than ETF Fever, JPM Says
body:
This weekâ€™s launch of the ProShares Bitcoin Strategy Exchange-Traded Fund (BITO) may have aided the cryptocurrencyâ€™s recent price surge to an all-time high, though the perception of bitcoin as an inflation hedge over gold is probably a bigger factor, a JPMorgan strategist wrote Thursday.

* In its first two days of trading, BITO amassed assets of over $1 billion, according to ProShares.
* Bloomberg ETF analyst Eric Balchunas says the new ProShares fund is the [fastest](https://twitter.com/EricBalchunas/status/1451215742238609415) in the history of the ETF industry to reach $1 billion in two sessions; such an ascent eclipsed the SPDR Gold Trust (GLD) ETFâ€™s 18-year record at three days to reach this level.
* JPMorgan strategist Nikolaos Panigirtzoglou wrote in a note to clients that thereâ€™s been a shift from gold ETFs into bitcoin funds since September, and there are already existing vehicles for investors to gain bitcoin exposure; the bank sees this shift in flows being bullish for bitcoin into year-end.
* BITO saw trading volume of over 29 million shares Wednesday, representing over $1.2 billion, according to a representative from the company.
* Separately, billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones [told](https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/20/paul-tudor-jones-says-crypto-is-his-preferred-inflation-hedge-over-gold-right-now.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=tk&cdlcid=5f2b29166be319c3c3a71176) CNBC earlier this week he currently prefers bitcoin over gold as an inflation hedge.

***See also: [Paul Tudor Jones: â€˜Inflation â€¦ \[Is\] the Single Biggest Threat to Financial Markets and Society in Generalâ€™](https://www.coindesk.com/podcasts/the-breakdown-with-nlw/paul-tudor-jones-inflation-is-the-single-biggest-threat-to-financial-markets-and-society-in-general/)***

title: Asian tech shares jump, China property stocks rally as Evergrande makes payment
body:
By Kevin Buckland

TOKYO (Reuters) - Tech stocks climbed in Asia on Friday, following U.S. peers higher, while Chinese property stocks rallied following a surprise interest payment https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-evergrande-sends-funds-trustee-bond-coupon-due-sept-23-source-2021-10-22 by debt-ridden property developer China Evergrande Group.

Meanwhile cyclical stocks dragged amid worries that central bankers will need to tighten monetary policy into slowing growth in order to tackle persistent inflation.

Regional bond yields rose with those on U.S. Treasuries, where the market priced in higher inflation by narrowing the spread between short- and long-term yields, and pushing breakeven rates to the highest since 2012.

The dollar held gains from overnight - when it rose the most since the start of last week against major peers - as better jobs and housing data boosted the case for a faster tapering of Federal Reserve stimulus and earlier interest rate hikes.

[Japan's Nikkei](https://www.investing.com/indices/japan-ni225) rose 0.7% led by technology shares, while energy shares were the biggest drag. The broader [Topix](https://www.investing.com/indices/topix) added 0.3%, with a 0.6% jump in the Topix growth index handily outpacing a 0.1% advance for the value index.

Chinese blue chips gained 0.3%, with the CSI300 Real Estate Index rising 2.5%. Hong Kong's [Hang Seng](https://www.investing.com/indices/hang-sen-40) rose 0.4%, as an index tracking Hong Kong-listed mainland developers rallied 4.3%.

Australia's benchmark index slipped 0.2% as commodity-linked shares fell.

China Evergrande Group wired funds to a trustee account on Thursday for a dollar bond interest payment due Sept. 23, a source told Reuters on Friday, days before a deadline that would have plunged the embattled developer into formal default. The stock jumped 5.4%.

MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan edged down 0.1%.

Meanwhile, [S&P 500](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500) E-minis futures slipped 0.1% after the cash index posted a record closing high overnight, led by surging tech shares.

The S&P 500 added 0.3%, while the [Nasdaq Composite](https://www.investing.com/indices/nasdaq-composite) rallied 0.6%, although the [Dow Jones Industrial Average](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-30) edged slightly lower.

Next week, almost all the so-called FAANG giants report earnings: Facebook (NASDAQ:[FB](https://www.investing.com/equities/facebook-inc)), Apple (NASDAQ:[AAPL](https://www.investing.com/equities/apple-computer-inc)), Amazon (NASDAQ:[AMZN](https://www.investing.com/equities/amazon-com-inc)), and Google-owner Alphabet (NASDAQ:[GOOGL](https://www.investing.com/equities/google-inc)). Netflix (NASDAQ:[NFLX](https://www.investing.com/equities/netflix,-inc.)) posted its results on Oct.19, and for the quarter that ended in September, diluted earnings-per-share came in at $3.19, beating analyst expectations of $2.57.

"The narrative over the last couple of days has been earnings focused and tech stocks have led the charge," said Kyle Rodda, a market analyst at IG Australia. "There's momentum there, simple as that."

At the same time, he said concerns over growth and inflation has raised speculation that central banks will increase interest rates, potentially crimping growth, and that is weighing particularly heavily on cyclical shares.

Oil prices resumed their climb on Friday, after dropping back from multi-year highs reached earlier in the week, amid continued tightness in U.S. supply.

[Brent crude](https://www.investing.com/commodities/brent-oil) added 0.2% to $84.77, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude rose 0.2% to $82.65.

The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits dropped last week to a 19-month low, data showed overnight, pointing to a tighter labor market.

Yields on benchmark [10-year Treasury notes](https://www.investing.com/rates-bonds/u.s.-10-year-bond-yield) were at 1.6922%, holding close to a five-month high of 1.7050% reached overnight. Two-year yields at 0.4484% were also close to the overnight high of 0.4560%, a level not seen since March of last year.

The [dollar index](https://www.investing.com/currencies/us-dollar-index), which gauges the greenback against six major rivals, was largely flat at 93.730 on Friday, maintaining the previous session's 0.2% gain.

The Fed has signaled it could start to taper stimulus as soon as next month, with rate hikes following late next year.

Fed Chair Jerome Powell speaks later on Friday in a panel discussion.

title: Warning Flags Flying For Tesla On The Weekly Chart
body:
The weekly chart for Tesla (NASDAQ:[TSLA](https://www.investing.com/equities/tesla-motors)) is coming to an interesting point from a technical perspective. And, as always, there are several key volume price analysis lessons as we look both back at the year and forward to the next.

First, letâ€™s start with a look back to the second week of 2021, with the wide spread up candle which took the stock price from $719 t0 $880 per share. An explosive move but look at the volume associated with the extreme price action. It is high certainly, but compare it with the previous up candles in both November and December of which we have three and consider the volume. The spread of each is half that of the extreme candle, yet the volumes are much the same or higher.

What does this tell us? Simply that the extreme move of early January is a very clear anomaly of effort and result and Wyckoffâ€™s third law and, therefore, is likely to be a trap move as the market makers are not participating and drawing in traders and investors on the fear of missing out, or FOMO. No surprise, therefore, when the price reverses.

Moving forward to the current price action of the last few weeks, once again we are starting to see warning signals appearing.

First, we are approaching the old top of January.

Second, notice how the volume, in general, has been declining consistently throughout the year and, more particularly, last week where we have a wide spread up candle on low volume.

Compare last weekâ€™s price spread with that of the candles I outlined above in December 2020. Yes, the price spread is a little less than these, but not great, yet look at the volume which is less than half and perhaps even a third and less than 100 million on the week. So, like the [ES E-mini](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500-futures), warning flags are flying in an increasingly strong headwind.

title: ShibX, Dogecoin, Elon Musk And The Growth Of The Cryptocurrency Asset Class
body:
*This article was written exclusively for Investing.com*

* Musk has his fingers in many tech-based pies
* He pumps, but he doesnâ€™t dump
* Dogecoin: a Musk favorite
* ShibX: meme-crypto derivative of Dogecoin
* Pack of followers riding the meme sled with Elon Musk driving

The quest for the next explosive cryptocurrency has become a dream for treasure hunters. Nothing ignites a marketâ€™s speculative fervor like the chance to turn a single dollar into an over one-million-dollar fortune in a little more than a decade.

Not since the US gold rush in the 1800s have so many fortunes appeared from thin air. Those with the foresight to realize [Bitcoin](https://www.investing.com/crypto/bitcoin/btc-usd) would burst on the scene and change the status quo notions of currencies made fortunes. A $1 investment in Bitcoin in 2010 at five cents was worth $1.14 million at the end of last week, with the leading cryptocurrency trading at the $57,000 per token level. It's worth even more this week even after the token is off its record high price above $66,000, hit on Wednesday.

Cryptocurrencies are the offspring of technological advances, as is the power of social media. The public relations effort in cryptos has only enhanced interest in the asset class. Elon Musk, founder and CEO of Tesla (NASDAQ:[TSLA](https://www.investing.com/equities/tesla-motors)) is a brilliant engineer. The EV company he built has provided wealth for early investors as it became the worldâ€™s most valuable automobile manufacturer.

Musk is also the founder of SpaceX and The Boring Company and the worldâ€™s wealthiest person currently, with an over $200 billion net worth. As well, he's a big supporter of cryptocurrencies. When asked how regulators should approach the cryptocurrency asset class in a recent interview, he said they should leave it alone. Kara Swisher, a New York Times columnist, asked Elon whether the US government should be involved in regulating the crypto space. Musks' answer: â€œ*I would say, do nothing*.â€

Elon Musk supports the growth of the cryptocurrency asset class. He and his companies hold sizeable long positions in a host of crypto tokens. When he tweets about one token or another, the prices rise and fall based on the tone of his message. Aside from his business interests, Elon Musk is one of the most influential forces in the asset class.

## Musk has his fingers in many tech-based pies

Elon Musk is now the worldâ€™s wealthiest individual. He recently overtook Jeff Bezos for that honor. His current net worth of well over $200 billion means he has more money than Bill Gates and Warren Buffett combined.

Musk is also an engineer. Aside from founding SpaceX and The Boring Company, he was an early-stage investor, CEO, and product architect for Tesla. He is also a co-founder of Neuralink and Open AI.

He was also instrumental in creating the company that became PayPal (NASDAQ:[PYPL](https://www.investing.com/equities/paypal-holdings-inc)). PYPLâ€™s $1.5 billion sale to eBay (NASDAQ:[EBAY](https://www.investing.com/equities/ebay-inc)) in 2002 provided the seed money for the launch of SpaceX that same year.

Clearly, Musk is a busy man. His experience with PayPal and technology in general have given him deep knowledge as well as a pedigree in the payments business. A good bridge as it were to cryptocurrencies which are a revolutionary financial technology and means of exchange that reflect the evolution of finance.

## He pumps, but he doesnâ€™t dump

In my view, Musk is a genius and a modern-day DaVinci, a true Renaissance man. But his style is irreverent.

He has taken on short-sellers and nonbelievers in Tesla shares, raising the hackles of the US's Securities and Exchange Commission. He threatened to [take Tesla private](https://www.cnbc.com/2018/08/08/elon-musk-wants-to-take-tesla-private--heres-what-it-means.html) at $420 per share in 2018 when the stock was trading around the $372 level. The same year, he appeared on [Joe Roganâ€™s podcast](https://www.vox.com/business-and-finance/2018/9/8/17834910/elon-musk-joe-rogan-podcast-tesla-stock) in a two-hour convesation and video where the pair drank whiskey and smoked marijuana.

Last summer, at the B-word conference, a major cryptocurrency event, Mr. Musk prodded regulators again, expressing his support for digital currencies when he said, â€œ*I might pump, but I donâ€™t dump*â€ cryptocurrencies.

## Dogecoin: a Musk favorite

While the world focuses on Bitcoin and [Ethereum](https://www.investing.com/crypto/ethereum/eth-usd), the crypto pack leaders, Musk has taken a particular interest in [Dogecoin](https://www.investing.com/crypto/dogecoin/doge-usd) (DOGE). Along with billionaire Mark Cuban, Musk agrees that Dogecoin is a powerful medium of exchange.

In May 2021, [he tweeted](https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1392974251011895300) that he was:

> *â€œWorking with Doge devs to improve system transaction efficiency.â€ Potentially promising.â€*

Each of his Dogecoin tweets seemed to push the price higher. As of Oct. 18, DOGE remains a leader in the asset class. It's now the ninth leading cryptocurrency, trading at around the 25.5 cents level, with a market cap of around $33.5 billion.

Dogecoin was the child of software engineers Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer, who decided to create a payment system as a â€œjoke.â€ But with a $33.5 billion valuation and high-profile support the digital currency no longer something to laugh at.

DOGE is a satirical homage to Bitcoin with a brand. The internet meme centered around the image of a Shiba Inu dog with bad spelling habits, explains â€œdogeâ€ instead of â€œdog.â€ In June 2021, Musk tweeted the following:

Obviously, he loves that canine!

A new cryptocurrency, Shibavax (SHIBX) is a knock-off of that original joke that's soared since it came to market on Oct. 10. ShibX mainly took blight because of the popularity of Doge.

## ShibX: meme-crypto derivative of Dogecoin

Shibavaxâ€™s [website](https://shibavax.io/) outlines the new entry into the cryptocurrency market. ShibX is a reflection token, meaning it takes a 10% reflection fee on each transfer and distributes it to all ShibX holders. Essentially, the token rewards passive investors with dividends.

On Oct. 19, 12,878 cryptocurrencies comprised the asset class. ShibX was the 3092nd token, putting it in the top 24% of all cryptos.

title: Opening Bell: Evergrande, Inflation Drive Global Market Slide; Bitcoin Higher
body:
* Evergrande in a tailspin after deal collapses, weighing on markets
* Dollar rallies despite falling yields
* Bitcoin retains record highs

## Key Events

Stocks and US futures on the [Dow](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-30-futures), [S&P](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500-futures), [NASDAQ](https://www.investing.com/indices/nq-100-futures) and [Russell 2000](https://www.investing.com/indices/smallcap-2000-futures?cid=1174944) sold off on Thursday after Chinese real estate developer, Evergrande announced that the sale of a significant stake in its property management groupâ€”in order to shore up the company's teetering financial stabilityâ€”had [collapsed](https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/china-evergrande-shares-fall-as-26-billion-evergrande-property-sale-collapses-2650394), adding to traders' concerns about markets and rising global inflation.

Treasury yields fell but the dollar advanced.

## Global Financial Affairs

All four US contracts were trading in the red this morning, with the Russell most deeply in negative territory.

The [STOXX 600](https://www.investing.com/indices/stoxx-600) Index slipped from its highest levels in six weeks, following an the earlier Asian selloffâ€”which saw the [Hang Seng](https://www.investing.com/indices/hang-sen-40) decline 0.5%â€”on news of the collapse of a $2.6 billion sale of the property management arm of the beleaguered Evergrande Group (HK:[3333](https://www.investing.com/equities/evergrande)). The shares slumped 12.5%, on the announcement while Evergrande Property Services Group (HK:[6666](https://www.investing.com/equities/evergrande-property-services-group)) slid 8%.

Miners, automakers and industrial stocks pulled down the pan-European benchmarkâ€”sectors sensitive to the economic recoveryâ€”as investors worry about future corporate earnings in an economy battling the highest inflation in years.

Yesterday's uneven US session saw the [S&P 500](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500) inch toward its record high, but the [NASDAQ 100](https://www.investing.com/indices/nq-100) retreated, imbuing markets with a cautious air.

Despite a slide in [10-year](https://www.investing.com/rates-bonds/u.s.-10-year-bond-yield) Treasury yields, the [dollar](https://www.investing.com/currencies/us-dollar-index) gained.

Dollar Index Daily

The USD bounced off the neckline of a massive double bottom. If prices close at the level at which they are now, they will have developed a bullish hammer.

[Gold](https://www.investing.com/commodities/gold) managed to hold on to yesterday's gains despite the strength of the greenback.

Gold Daily

Still, the yellow metal gave up an advance after the 100 DMA crossed below the 200 DMA as it neared the neckline of a H&S continuation pattern.

[Bitcoin](https://www.investing.com/crypto/bitcoin/btc-usd) bulls had a great day on Wednesday as the cryptocurrency's price finally broke through the $66,000 level.

Today, the digital token managed to hit yesterday's closing price after a small dip. JPMorgan notes the surge in demand has been fueled by [inflation](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/cpi-733).

Much of the current exuberance has been attributed to the launch, on Tuesday of the ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF (NYSE:[BITO](https://www.investing.com/etfs/proshares-bitcoin-strategy)) which topped $1 billion in assets in just two days.

Presumably, speculators are enjoying the fun ahead of the launch of a second US Bitcoin ETF, the [Valkyrie Bitcoin Strategy ETF](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/valkyrie-says-second-u-s-bitcoin-etf-will-start-trading-friday) (BTF) on Friday with others due to follow next week.

Bitcoin Daily

The price of the leading crypto formed a Hanging Man. That's bearish upon a close and a confirming candle, which would occur if the price closes below the real body of today's candle. Bulls may be exhausted after BTC's incredible 60% vault since late September.

The cryptocurrency is likely to correct and find support at the top of the broken rising channel before taking on new heights.

[Oil](https://www.investing.com/commodities/crude-oil) is falling from a 7-year high due to a surprise drop in [stockpiles](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/crude-oil-inventories-75).

Oil Daily

When the price of an asset falls despite supposed bullish news, it's bearish. The oil price is falling after forming a hanging man yesterday. Preferably, the hanging man would not have had any upper shadow, but if the price today closes below yesterday's opening level, it might be a bearish signal.

The RSI is turning lower after reaching the most overbought condition since February so the next support will probably be the uptrend line at around $80.

## Up Ahead

* German [manufacturing PMI](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/greek-manufacturing-pmi-1472) is reported on Friday.
* Canada releases [retail sales](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/retail-sales-260) figures for August on Friday.
* On Friday Fed Chair Jerome Powell takes part in a policy panel discussion.

title: Social Security Raise Has Recipients Coming Out Ahead Of Inflation
body:
*This article was originally published at the [Humble Dollar.](https://humbledollar.com/2021/10/coming-out-ahead/)*

Last week's news that Social Security recipients will receive a 5.9% cost-of-living adjustment for 2022 might seem like a nonevent. After all, those larger monthly checks will be fully devoured by todayâ€™s higher prices.

Or maybe not.

Septemberâ€™s report for the [Consumer Price Index](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/cpi-69) (CPI) showed that [inflation](https://www.bls.gov/news.release/cpi.t02.htm) for medical care servicesâ€”a big cost for retireesâ€”was quite tame over the past 12 months, rising less than 1%. Seniors also spend significantly less on transportation, so theyâ€™re less harmed by the past yearâ€™s 15% surge in the cost of new and used cars and trucks, as well as motor vehicle parts.

On the downside, younger retireesâ€”or, at least, those willing to travel during the pandemicâ€”have likely felt the brunt of the 18% jump in the cost of â€œlodging away from home.â€ One plus for travelers: A strong [U.S. dollar](https://www.investing.com/currencies/us-dollar-index) has made overseas excursions less pricey. Those in their 60s usually travel more, while those ages 75 and up tend to spend a higher amount on health care.

Next year may be kinder to all consumers. According to Bank of America analysts, [core CPI](https://twitter.com/MikeZaccardi/status/1449704984228945920)â€”which excludes volatile food and energy itemsâ€”will rise 4.3% in 2021 and 3.1% in 2022. The Federal Reserve, which looks at a somewhat [different inflation measure](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/pce-price-index-906), expects [core inflation](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/core-cpi-736) to be even lower.

What does all this mean? Arguably, those receiving Social Security checks are getting a pretty good deal. Theyâ€™re receiving a 5.9% raise, while their cost of living appears to be climbing at a slower rate.

title: Canopy Growth Makes Another Strategic Move As It Awaits U.S. Cannabis Legalization
body:
Canopy Growth (NASDAQ:[CGC](https://www.investing.com/equities/tweed-marijuana-inc?cid=1057241)) (TSX:[WEED](https://www.investing.com/equities/tweed-marijuana-inc)) is [planning to buy](https://www.canopygrowth.com/investors/news-releases/canopy-growth-announces-plan-to-acquire-wana-brands-the-1-cannabis-edibles-brand-in-north-america/) Wana Brands, the Number One cannabis edible brand in North America. That was the big news in the cannabis sector last week, as the announcement was made last Thursday.

But just how big a deal it will be has yet to be seen.

Canopy Daily

Canopy Growth stock immediately reacted to the news, gaining about $1, or about 8%, in intraday trade last Friday, hitting $14.36 on the [NASDAQ](https://www.investing.com/indices/nasdaq-composite). But the cannabis producer closed the week at $13.35 almost exactly where it was the day before the announcement.

That doesnâ€™t mean the deal won't hold huge potential upside in the future for the Canadian-based pot company. Wana Brands is a leading player in the US edibles market, which is one of the fastest-growing sectors in the cannabis space. By market share, Wana is the biggest brand in the US. And according to Canopyâ€™s research, edibles areâ€”and will continue to beâ€”the most popular entry point for new customers in the cannabis market.

The announced deal gives Canopy the right to buy Wana upon federal legalization of marijuana.

The delayed acquisition is structured on three separate option agreements. First, Canopy will make an upfront payment of US$297.5 million (C$366 million) in cash. The options agreements position Canopy with a call option to buy all of the interests in three of Wanaâ€™s subsidiariesâ€”Mountain High Products, Wana Wellness and The Cima Group.

When the deal is triggered, Canopy will own and operate Wanaâ€™s facility in Colorado and hold its operating licences in 11 states. But the company is rapidly expanding. By the end of 2022, Wana is expected to be operating in more than 20 states.

Said Canopy CEO David Klein in a statement:

> *â€œAs we establish Canopy Growth as the worldâ€™s leading cannabis company, acquiring the #1 cannabis edibles brand in North America will serve to strengthen our market position in both Canada and the United States. The right to acquire Wana secures another major, direct pathway into the US. THC market upon federal permissibility, and in Canada weâ€™ll be adding the top-ranked cannabinoid gummies to our industry-leading house of brands. Weâ€™re confident in the future growth of the edibles category and the tremendous opportunities with Wana.â€*

But the real size of this move for Canopy has to be viewed through the lens of its other strategic deal to not only enter the US market upon legalization of marijuana in the States, but immediately be a dominant player in the largest pot market in the world. That other deal is namely its agreement to acquire another major name in the US marketâ€”Acreage Holdings (OTC:[ACRGF](https://www.investing.com/equities/acreage-holdings-inc?cid=1116263)), a multi-state operator.

These two deals will allow Canopy to move quickly in establishing itself in the US market, not only in the recreational pot market, but in the two major expansion lanesâ€”edibles and infused beverages.

## Reflecting on Canadian legalization

Sunday marked the third anniversary of the legalization of marijuana in Canada. The occasion is giving regulators the incentive to reflect on what has gone right and what has gone wrong.

To that end, the Canadian government has announced an 18-month review of its legislation that legalized the substance, which many in the industry hope will bring about changes to reduce the regulatory hurdles that include packaging restrictions and potency limits.

But here are two take-aways of note: Since legalization, about half the illicit pot market has been eliminated in Canada. And, according to government statistics, C$1.068.9 billion (US$867.55 million) in federal and provincial taxes have been generated from the legal sale of cannabis since October 2018, when legalization was enacted. That offers two big societal gains.

title: USD Outlook: Risk Appetite Versus Fed Taper Plans
body:
Stronger than expected earnings drove the [Dow Jones Industrial Average](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-30) to record highs. Despite Delta variant fears, rising prices and supply-chain shortage, bulge bracket U.S. companies are thriving. More than 85% of [S&P 500](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500) companies that reported as of Tuesday beat expectations in the third quarter.Â Results like these hardens the case for tapering by the Federal Reserve in November.Â Normally, the prospect of taper should be positive for the U.S. dollar and in many ways, it has for [USD/JPY](https://www.investing.com/currencies/usd-jpy), which rose to its strongest level since November 2017.Â However, thatâ€™s where the [greenback](https://www.investing.com/indices/usdollar)â€™s gains end as it traded lower against other major currencies.Â 

Â 

Proper policy communication has long been one of the most important jobs of the central bank, especially when major changes are anticipated. The fact that the U.S. dollar is not soaring with less than two weeks to the FOMC meeting is a testament to the Fedâ€™s success.Â It said it would prepare the market for any change and it has done a decent job doing so.Â Thereâ€™s little doubt that it wonâ€™t act in November and, by now, investors have completely priced in the move. This explains why good data and record-breaking moves in equities did not drive the U.S. dollar higher.Â 

Â 

The [Beige Book](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/beige-book-10) report was also slightly more downbeat, with reports of slower growth.Â More specifically, it said: â€œOutlooks for near-term economic activity remained positive, overall, but some districts noted increased uncertainty and more cautious optimism than in previous months.â€Â 

Â 

Ultimately the greenback is a safe-haven currency, and with stocks hitting record highs, investors are moving their money into riskier currencies, like the Australian and New Zealand dollars.Â They are more sensitive to global growth and the ebbs and tides of the global economy.

Â 

Although, [sterling](https://www.investing.com/currencies/gbp-usd) and the [Canadian dollar](https://www.investing.com/currencies/cad-usd) traded higher today.Â U.K. inflation data fell short of expectations, while Canadaâ€™s CPI report beat.Â Consumer prices grew 0.3% in the month of September, down from 0.7% the prior month in the U.K.Â Year-over-year growth eased to 3.1% from 3.2%. Many economists are warning investors not to the fooled by this downshift because the slowdown was largely due to a measurement quirk. A meal subsidy scheme in August pushed up last monthâ€™s inflation readings.Â High price pressures remain a problem that worries the Bank of England. In Canada, CPI rose 0.2%, slightly more than expected. Year over year, the annualized pace of growth rose to 4.4% from 4.1%. [USD/CAD](https://www.investing.com/currencies/usd-cad) dropped to fresh three-month lows in response.Â The [Australian](https://www.investing.com/currencies/aud-usd) and [New Zealand](https://www.investing.com/currencies/nzd-usd) dollars continued to lead the gains. The [euro](https://www.investing.com/currencies/eur-usd) also participated, thanks to stronger German producer prices.Â Â Â

title: 3 Ways To Trade IBM After Big Blue Disappoints
body:
IBM stock is up over 12% so far in 2021 and hit a multi-year high in June
Big Blue reported weaker-than-expected Q3 earnings, raising eyebrows
Despite potential short-term volatility, buy-and-hold investors could use any further short-term shares price decline as an opportune entry point
Investors in tech giant International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) have seen their shares gain 12.1% year-to-date after hitting a multi-year high of $152.84 in June. But yesterday the stock slid 4% in extended trading after Big Blue missed revenue forecasts when it reported Q3 results. Quarterly revenue was up just 0.3% to $17.6 billion and adjusted earnings came in at $2.52 per share, down 2%.

However, when numbers for the company's Kyndryl, managed infrastructure business are excluded, revenue at IBM increased by 2.5%. In October, IBMâ€™s board approved the spin-off of Kyndryl into a separate business. "Once distributed, each holder of IBM common stock will receive one share of Kyndryl common stock for every five shares of IBM common stock held on Oct. 25, 2021.â€

This upcoming spin-off will enable a new IBM to emerge. Yet Wall Street is still debating if the move will be sufficient enough for management to make IBM viable in the competitive cloud market where Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) have already made big inroads.

IBM WeeklyIBM Weekly
The 52-week range for shares of Big Blue has been $105.92 - $152.84, while the companyâ€™s market capitalization stands at $127.18 billion. As we write, the current price of $141.90 supports a dividend yield of 4.62%.

IBM, which was founded in 1911, has a storied history which includes both achievements and hurdles. In recent years, management has been working to expand its hybrid-cloud ecosystem and artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The company's Q3 free cash flow stood at $0.6 billion. And, since year-end 2020, the company reduced debt by $7.0 billion.

During the earnings call, CEO Arvind Krishna said:

â€œWe continue to make progress in our software and consulting businesses, which represent our higher growth opportunitiesâ€¦ \[W\]e are confident in achieving our medium-term objectives of mid-single digit revenue growth and strong free cash flow generation.â€

What To Expect From IBM Stock
Among 19 analysts polled via [Investing.com](http://Investing.com), IBM stock has an â€˜outperform' rating.

Source: [Investing.com](http://Investing.com)

The shares have a 12-month price target of $151.77, implying an increase of about 7% from current levels. The 12-month price range currently stands between $115 and $176.

Trailing P/E, P/S and P/B ratios for IBM stock stand at 24.53x, 1.71x and 5.8x, respectively. By comparison, these ratios for another tech heavyweight, [Salesforce.com](http://Salesforce.com) (NYSE:CRM), are 115.95x, 12.16x, and 5.15x. On the other hand, they are 24.99x, 5.65x, and 4.49x for Germany-headquartered SAP (NYSE:SAP).

Readers who watch technical charts might be interested to know that a number of IBM's short-term oscillators are cautioning investors. However, long-term â€œbuyâ€ signals are still intact.

Our expectation is for IBM stock to slide below the $135 level and toward $130, where it is likely to find initial support. If that level gets breached, than the next target would be $125, where there would be strong support. The shares then would likely trade sideways while establishing a new base.

3 Possible Trades On International Business Machines

1. Buy IBM Stock At Current Levels

Investors who are not concerned with daily moves in price and who believe in the long-term potential of the company could consider investing in International Business Machines stock now.

On Oct. 20, IBM stock closed at $141.90. It is likely that the shares will open lower on Oct. 21.

Buy-and-hold investors should expect to keep this long position for several months while the stock first makes an attempt at analystsâ€™ price target of $151.77, returning 7% from the current level. Then, the next level to watch would be the recent multi-year high of $152.84. Investors should expect to hold this position for several months, if not multiple quarters.

Readers who plan to invest soon but are concerned about large declines might also consider placing a stop-loss at about 3-5% below their entry point.

1. Buy An ETF With IBM As A Main Holding

Many readers are familiar with the fact that we regularly cover exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that might be suitable for buy-and-hold investors. Thus, readers who do not want to commit capital to IBM stock but would still like to have substantial exposure to the shares could consider researching a fund that holds the company as a top holding.

Examples of such ETFs include:

Invesco Dow Jones Industrial Average Dividend ETF (NYSE:DJD): This fund is up 16.6% YTD, and IBM stockâ€™s weighting is 7.27%;
Global Beta Smart Income ETF (NYSE:GBDV): The fund is up 20.6% YTD, and IBM stockâ€™s weighting is 4.73%;
Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETFâ„¢ (NYSE:SCHD): The fund is up 21.9% YTD, and IBM stockâ€™s weighting is 4.16%;
Capital Link NextGen Protocol ETF (NYSE:KOIN): The fund is up 19.1% YTD, and IBM stockâ€™s weighting is 3.16%.
3\. Bear Put Spread

Readers who believe there could be some profit-taking in IBM stock in the short run might consider initiating a bear put spread strategy. As it involves options, this set up will not be appropriate for all investors.

It might also be appropriate for long-term IBM investors to use this strategy in conjunction with their long stock position. The set-up would offer some short-term protection against a decline in price in the coming weeks.

This trade requires a trader to have one long IBM put with a higher strike price and one short IBM put with a lower strike price. Both puts will have the same expiration date.

Such a bear put spread would be established for a net debit (or net cost). It will profit if IBM shares decline in price. Letâ€™s now look at an example with closing numbers from Oct. 20. When the market opens later today, these prices will be different. However, the method of risk/return calculation is the same.

For instance, the trader might buy an out-of-the-money (OTM) put option, like the IBM 21 January 2022 135-strike put option. This option is currently offered at $3.73. Thus, it would cost the trader $373 to own this put option, which expires in about three months.

At the same time, the trader would sell another put option with a lower strike, like the IBM Jan.21 125-strike put option. This option is currently offered at $1.61. Thus, the trader would receive $161 to sell this put option, which also expires in about three months.

The maximum risk of this trade would be equal to the cost of the put spread (plus commissions). In our example, the maximum loss would be ($3.73 -1.61) X 100 = $212.00 (plus commissions).

This maximum loss of $212 could easily be realized if the position is held to expiry and both IBM puts expire worthless. Both puts will expire worthless if the IBM share price at expiration is above the strike price of the long put (higher strike), which is $135 at this point.

This tradeâ€™s potential profit is limited to the difference between the strike prices (i.e., ($135.00 - $125.00) X 100) minus the net cost of the spread (i.e., $212.00) plus commissions.

In our example, the difference between the strike prices is $10.00. Therefore, the profit potential is $1,000 - $212 = $788.

This trade would break even at $132.88 on the day of the expiry (excluding brokerage commissions).

title: Opening Bell: Evergrande, Inflation Drive Global Market Slide; Bitcoin Higher
body:
* Evergrande in a tailspin after deal collapses, weighing on markets
* Dollar rallies despite falling yields
* Bitcoin retains record highs

## Key Events

Stocks and US futures on the [Dow](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-30-futures), [S&P](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500-futures), [NASDAQ](https://www.investing.com/indices/nq-100-futures) and [Russell 2000](https://www.investing.com/indices/smallcap-2000-futures?cid=1174944) sold off on Thursday after Chinese real estate developer, Evergrande announced that the sale of a significant stake in its property management groupâ€”in order to shore up the company's teetering financial stabilityâ€”had [collapsed](https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/china-evergrande-shares-fall-as-26-billion-evergrande-property-sale-collapses-2650394), adding to traders' concerns about markets and rising global inflation.

Treasury yields fell but the dollar advanced.

## Global Financial Affairs

All four US contracts were trading in the red this morning, with the Russell most deeply in negative territory.

The [STOXX 600](https://www.investing.com/indices/stoxx-600) Index slipped from its highest levels in six weeks, following an the earlier Asian selloffâ€”which saw the [Hang Seng](https://www.investing.com/indices/hang-sen-40) decline 0.5%â€”on news of the collapse of a $2.6 billion sale of the property management arm of the beleaguered Evergrande Group (HK:[3333](https://www.investing.com/equities/evergrande)). The shares slumped 12.5%, on the announcement while Evergrande Property Services Group (HK:[6666](https://www.investing.com/equities/evergrande-property-services-group)) slid 8%.

Miners, automakers and industrial stocks pulled down the pan-European benchmarkâ€”sectors sensitive to the economic recoveryâ€”as investors worry about future corporate earnings in an economy battling the highest inflation in years.

Yesterday's uneven US session saw the [S&P 500](https://www.investing.com/indices/us-spx-500) inch toward its record high, but the [NASDAQ 100](https://www.investing.com/indices/nq-100) retreated, imbuing markets with a cautious air.

Despite a slide in [10-year](https://www.investing.com/rates-bonds/u.s.-10-year-bond-yield) Treasury yields, the [dollar](https://www.investing.com/currencies/us-dollar-index) gained.

Dollar Index Daily

The USD bounced off the neckline of a massive double bottom. If prices close at the level at which they are now, they will have developed a bullish hammer.

[Gold](https://www.investing.com/commodities/gold) managed to hold on to yesterday's gains despite the strength of the greenback.

Gold Daily

Still, the yellow metal gave up an advance after the 100 DMA crossed below the 200 DMA as it neared the neckline of a H&S continuation pattern.

[Bitcoin](https://www.investing.com/crypto/bitcoin/btc-usd) bulls had a great day on Wednesday as the cryptocurrency's price finally broke through the $66,000 level.

Today, the digital token managed to hit yesterday's closing price after a small dip. JPMorgan notes the surge in demand has been fueled by [inflation](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/cpi-733).

Much of the current exuberance has been attributed to the launch, on Tuesday of the ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF (NYSE:[BITO](https://www.investing.com/etfs/proshares-bitcoin-strategy)) which topped $1 billion in assets in just two days.

Presumably, speculators are enjoying the fun ahead of the launch of a second US Bitcoin ETF, the [Valkyrie Bitcoin Strategy ETF](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/valkyrie-says-second-u-s-bitcoin-etf-will-start-trading-friday) (BTF) on Friday with others due to follow next week.

Bitcoin Daily

The price of the leading crypto formed a Hanging Man. That's bearish upon a close and a confirming candle, which would occur if the price closes below the real body of today's candle. Bulls may be exhausted after BTC's incredible 60% vault since late September.

The cryptocurrency is likely to correct and find support at the top of the broken rising channel before taking on new heights.

[Oil](https://www.investing.com/commodities/crude-oil) is falling from a 7-year high due to a surprise drop in [stockpiles](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/crude-oil-inventories-75).

Oil Daily

When the price of an asset falls despite supposed bullish news, it's bearish. The oil price is falling after forming a hanging man yesterday. Preferably, the hanging man would not have had any upper shadow, but if the price today closes below yesterday's opening level, it might be a bearish signal.

The RSI is turning lower after reaching the most overbought condition since February so the next support will probably be the uptrend line at around $80.

## Up Ahead

* German [manufacturing PMI](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/greek-manufacturing-pmi-1472) is reported on Friday.
* Canada releases [retail sales](https://www.investing.com/economic-calendar/retail-sales-260) figures for August on Friday.
* On Friday Fed Chair Jerome Powell takes part in a policy panel discussion.

## Market Moves

### Stocks

* The STOXX 600 fell 0.1% as of 8:49 a.m. London time
* Futures on the S&P 500 fell 0.2%
* Futures on the NASDAQ 100 fell 0.2%
* Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.2%
* The [MSCI Asia Pacific](https://www.investing.com/indices/msci-ac-asia-pacific) Index rose 0.4%
* The [MSCI Emerging Markets Index](https://www.investing.com/indices/msci-emerging-markets) rose 0.5%

### Currencies

* The [euro](https://www.investing.com/currencies/eur-usd) was little changed at $1.1644
* The [Japanese yen](https://www.investing.com/currencies/usd-jpy) rose 0.2% to 114.06 per dollar
* The [offshore yuan](https://www.investing.com/currencies/usd-cnh) was little changed at 6.3956 per dollar
* The [British pound](https://www.investing.com/currencies/gbp-usd) fell 0.1% to $1.3810

### Bonds

* The yield on 10-year Treasuries was little changed at 1.65%
* Germany's [10-year](https://www.investing.com/rates-bonds/germany-10-year-bond-yield) yield was little changed at -0.13%
* Britain's [10-year](https://www.investing.com/rates-bonds/uk-10-year-bond-yield) yield was little changed at 1.15%

### Commodities

* [Brent crude](https://www.investing.com/commodities/brent-oil) fell 0.7% to $85.23 a barrel
* [Spot gold](https://www.investing.com/currencies/xau-usd) was little changed

title: What are CryptoPunks?
body: CryptoPunks, a collection of 10,000 unique collectible characters, is widely considered to be the beginning of today's CryptoArt movement. on June 23, 2017, Larva Labs released CryptoPunks when anyone could get CryptoPunk for free. since then, the process has evolved to what it is today, according to Nansen According to Nansen, Punks are currently priced between 100.5 ETH ($381,000) and 4,200 ETH ($758,000), making it the largest NFT collection with a total market cap of 1,262,143 ETH ($4.5 billion).

title: Artizen DAO
body:
[Artizen](https://www.artizen.fund/) is the largest platform for artist grants, and has pioneered a new model for community funded and curated grants. Our mission is to transform the way culture and public goods are funded, beginning with the arts. We are moving to web3 and invite you to join us as we build [Artizen DAO](https://artizen.link/pitch-deck).

Artizen helps communities come together and support the things they care about. We make it easy to create grants, raise money, curate awards, and reward donors with NFTsâ€Šâ€”â€Ša positive-feedback cycle that powers sustained support for your field, community, or cause.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wh78apEs5zDx5xZeMcWIm.jpg?height=1185&width=1920&&&&&&size=medium)

## The Problem

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Baiou8j2Qv7gJFLh5Ka9C.png?height=838&width=2374&)

Grants are the lifeblood of the arts, but a new model for grants is deeply needed. The current system is centered around institutions, not communities, and as a result is bureaucratic, inefficient, and does not align incentives between donors, grantmakers, artists and fans:

* **Donors**: few rewards, no voice in curation, weak ties to artists, little stake in their success.
* **Grantmakers**: complex administration, overhead, challenges attracting and keeping donors.
* **Artists**: insufficient funding sources, onerous application processes, weak ties to donors. Few grants go directly to artists, most go to nonprofit gatekeepers who can afford full-time grant writers.
* **Fans**: not involved in the grant system at all, no incentive to become donors to a grant.

## The Solution

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fJonlq5vZGNGax7qPdwWp.png?height=802&width=2380)

Artizen has developed a new model for grants that weaves all of these interests together.  By combining crowdfunding, community curation, and NFT rewards, we can unlock new money, untapped network effects, and robust support.

* By giving donors a voice in where their money goes, we give fans a reason to become donors;
* By eliminating bureaucracy, we give more money directly to artists, and simplify processes for both artists and grantmakers;
* And by rewarding donors with NFTs, we give everyone a stake in the projectâ€™s success, attracting more donors and creating stronger ties between supporters and artists.

## Artizen Grants Unite People

![The Dance by Matisse](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S590-O_XWeO8WoW5-oULX.jpeg?height=997&width=1500)

Since launching our MVP in 2021, Artizen has awarded nearly $500K to artists across more than 100 grants, grown to 12K+ members, and partnered with major companies and cultural institutions including Microsoft, HP, Unity Technologies, and the Cannes and Tribeca Film Festivals. These partners are excited to underwrite community grants because we give them a way to directly support causes they care about, while removing the complexities of running a grant themselves.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8fyRkr5vVNpe3BixCRYi.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

If youâ€™re HP, or Academy Award Winner Viola Davis, and you want to encourage more Black visionaries to explore new technology, you can either create and run your own complicated incubator, mentorship or prize program â€“ or you can simply back an Artizen grant.

## Artizen Curation Engine

Group decision-making is a challenge.  How do you give a voice to donors without making it just another popularity contest?  How can you give unknown artists an extra leg up?  How can a grantmaker guarantee high standards for winning artists, and keep a grant aligned with its original mission?  How do you create a positive, wagmi culture and avoid a dynamic of â€˜winnersâ€™ vs. â€˜losersâ€™?   How do you balance the power of small donors against big donors?

We have been iterating on these difficult questions over 100 grant cycles.  The result is our Curation Engine, a selection system that balances and harmonizes these interests.  Grantmakers choose juries who select finalists, who can guarantee high standards and continuity of mission.  [Quadratic voting](https://vitalik.ca/general/2019/12/07/quadratic.html) balances small and large donor power while still incentivizing donation.  And everybody wins: splitting prizes proportionally to upvotes avoids the disappointment and bad blood of winner-take-all contests.

Hereâ€™s how a grant works in practice:

* Artists submit project proposals.
* Jury, selected by the grantmaker, chooses 3-10 finalists.
* Community donates to buy upvotes.
* Community votes for their favorite of the Finalists.
* Project with the most votes is the winner, but all Finalists receive the donations behind the votes they got.
* Winner creates an Artifact (more about this later).

![Artizen Curation Engine](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZMRZDCSXjwYcQdEaX8zPa.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

## Community Curation Drives Growth

Weâ€™ve discovered something remarkable: community curation drives growth.  By giving donors a voice in selecting winners, artists have a reason to invite fans, and fans have a reason to become donors. The most successful Artizen grants grow rapidly because of this dynamic, and we are modeling the web3 version of Artizen on their success.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FBwktpfurvbhcvq1zfSVV.png?height=908&width=2360)

## NFT Rewards

We are building a new version of our platform on web3 for two reasons.  The first is to use NFT rewards to â€˜close the loop,â€™ connecting the value of the art to the donors who support it.

For each grant cycle, donors will receive an NFT representing their support (a portion of an Artifact, described below).  Designed with the winning artist, it will combine the ideas of a [POAP](https://poap.xyz/) with NFT art â€“ both a badge of support and a tangible asset that can appreciate in step with the growth of the artistâ€™s career.  In addition, royalties from any trading of these tokens goes back into the Matching Fund to â€˜pay forwardâ€™ into future grants.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/H0CJWMuc8iMDHrGYku6rT.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

NFTs will also connect the success of individual grants to the health of the whole grant ecosystem through the ARTIZEN ARTIFACTS.

## Artifacts Power the Artizen DAO

The second reason we are moving to web3 is because we want Artizen to be owned by its community.

Artizen Artifacts are NFTs that represent collective ownership of the platform, which will transition to a DAO structure.  Artifact holders will be investors, arts leaders, grantmakers and grantwinners, and anyone else invested in building a brighter future for art, science, and culture.

![Vincent van Gogh's Ear](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s4yb1XaI_f4cwNWANhrPr.gif?height=338&width=600)

Royalties from Artifact sales go back into the Matching Fund, which will provide ongoing support for all grants.  Each grant cycle mints 3 new Artifacts, designed by the winning artist â€“ one for the DAO, one for the artist, and one fractionalized as rewards to their donors.

As the company transitions to distributed governance, the community can experiment with new structures and policies.

The collection begins with 1,111 objects from the history of art around the world, designed by Nak Yong Choi with sound by Elliot Cole.  These 3D objects will be interoperable with Jadu, Sandbox, and elsewhere in the metaverse.

And finally, this collection (and community) will grow as new grantwinning work is also memorialized in Artifacts.

title: Hidden dragon continent
body:
It is mainly because the extreme east of Qianlong continent is the boundless wilderness, which is covered with mountains and jungles. There are countless monsters in the wilderness. The deeper you go, the more powerful the monsters are, because even the 'celestial beings' on Qianlong continent cannot explore the whole boundless wilderness.

To the west, there are three great nations.

The three dynasties of Chu, Ming and Han have a combined population of nearly ten billion, and their land area is even more formidable. Among the three dynasties, the Chu dynasty is the most powerful, and among them, there is a very important family -- the Qin family.

The Qin family occupied the three eastern counties of the twelve counties of the Chu Dynasty, and the three eastern counties were close to the boundless wilderness.This qin family inherited for hundreds of years, in the three counties of the eastern region of the foundation is very deep, even the Emperor of chu dynasty want to deal with, are very difficult.And qin family has a special arms' fierce tiger army '.

Fierce tiger, red body, body is huge, is a branch of the tiger.Large-scale breed the method of strong tiger, this is qin jia the most important secret.

Qin control six hundred thousand army, there are fifty thousand is strong tiger army, the whole strong tiger army every soldier is riding 'strong tiger', strong tiger itself attack is terrible, plus soldiers, it is invincible.

The 'tiger roar' of 50,000 strong tigers alone can demoralize the enemy.An army of 50,000 strong tigers could easily wipe out an ordinary cavalry army of 100,000.

Qianlong is the most powerful continent. There are immortal practitioners in all three countries, and each immortal is immortal in the eyes of ordinary people.Fly a sword, thousands of miles outside can cut people's heads, royal sword flight, soaring in nine days, which is not immortal means?

\* \* \* \* \* \*

Yunwu Villa, built on the 'Donglanshan', donglanshan three thousand meters, also counted as a mountain.

Two years later.

Qin Yu at the moment eight years old, the height is also a lot higher, eyes sometimes have wise light flashing, but in the depths of his eyes has a touch of melancholy, qin Yu is alone at the moment on the mountain, there is a black eagle on its shoulder.

"Hei, for two years, the whole two years my father has only come to see me once."Qin Yu bite bite lips, to the shoulder of the eagle said.

The eagle is qin Yu a year ago when visiting Donglanshan found, they will take the eagle in the side, accompanied by the eagle, Qin Yu will not be too lonely, often accompanied by his father before the age of six, six years after the whole two years, but only saw his father once.

Black eagle fan wings, stroke Qinyu tender face, Qinyu immediately smiled.

Walk for a moment, Qin Yu suddenly saw the front of a pregnant woman but carrying broken wood difficult walk, immediately to the black hawk said: "small black, we go to help the aunt?"

The black eagle immediately fanned its wings, shaking on The shoulders of Qin Yu two times, Qin Yu immediately ran to the pregnant woman with a smile.

"Auntie, let me help you carry the wood."Qin Yu said looking at pregnant women.

Pregnant women heard the voice, put down the body of a bundle of wood, wipe the sweat on the head, looking at the child qinyu obviously, smile: "baby, thank you ah, aunt can back, and a mile to our village."Then he will carry the wood on his back again.

"Little dolls?I'm not young. I'm eight years old. I'm sure I can carry this wood."Qin Yu looked at the sweat on the face of pregnant women, unexpectedly a grab wood, suddenly a back on the body.

A bundle of wood for ordinary people natural not heavy, but for eight-year-old children is very heavy, but Qin Yu often bubble in the natural hot springs in yunwu Villa, the body is much stronger than eight-year-old children in general, unexpectedly just back up.

title: East lanshan
body:
Pregnant woman face smiled open flower: "this baby, do not know who is the child, there is such a child, his parents must be very happy."

Qin Yu carrying this bundle of wood, not difficult at the beginning, but after a road, Qin Yu felt his two legs began to be weak, after all, is up the mountain, but also carrying wood, Qin Yu even if the body is strong, but also eight years old.

After a moment, Qin Yu legs suddenly a tremble.

"She..."The pregnant woman was startled.

"No, it's easy."Qinyu turned back and tried to squeeze out a smile said, the tone he seemed to be a hercules, but the mountain road is rough, Qinyu foot encountered a stone, can not help but shake.

"Peng!"Qinyu whole person can not help but fall down.

Pregnant woman immediately hurriedly come up, took the wood, helped up Qinyu.Qinyu face at the moment is completely dust, a small face are dirty, Qinyu is very humbled to look at the pregnant woman: "Aunt, in fact...I can carry it. I was hit by a stone."

"Well, aunt knows you can carry, but the village is in front of you, thank you."

Pregnant women back wood, see Qinyu was not injured, after help Qinyu's face wiped clean, then carefully exhorted some, qinyu have to nod and agree, this just back to the village.

Qinyu looked at the village in front of the 100 meters or so, frowning: "small black, just a point on the difference."Immediately Qin Yu was laughing, "but aunt is much easier now, suddenly to the village."

Qin Yu smile is very bright, it is from the heart smile.

In the dark three figures look at each other, they are secretly protect qinyu master.

Qin Yu but the town east king's son, Tang Three Royal Highness, how can let him run around in the mountains?

"His Royal Highness is still a child, but his heart is so kind. How could he leave his Royal Highness at the Cloud Mountain Villa, and come to visit it only once every two years? Every time I see him sitting on the top of the mountain for a night, his little body in the cold wind at night, I feel sad.""A figure sighed in a low voice.

Another figure nodded. "Every time your Highness looks up at the night sky, it makes my heart ache.Alas!"

"Well, it is not for us to know what his royal highness wants. We will protect him."

All of a sudden -

Mountain road under a tiger back waist, eyes like copper bell size of the black big man riding a fierce very red tiger, speed rushed to see Qinyu, far high way: "three royal highness, big highness and two Royal highness came."

"Brother and brother are coming!"Qin Yu excited eyes bright, immediately flew toward the black big man ran, climbed on the back of the tiger, excited face red up, eagerly urged, "Wang Shu, walk, walk ah, back to the yunwu villa!"

That big han hold good Qinyu, and then control strong tiger, speed down the mountain ran, leaving a dust.

title: the friendship
body:
Friendship means being friendly to each other or making friends with one another. Human beings are social animals. They do not live in isolation.They need each other both physically and emotionally.

However, some people distort friendship by forming small groups that are harmful to others, or even to the whole community. In university some students from the same city or province form an association to help each other. But such associations often exclude students from other parts of the country, and thus do not promote friendship in a broad sense.

True and lasting friendship is based on a more solid foundation. Real friends share the same ideals. While marching toward their common objective, they help each other. If one makes a mistake, his friend will not hesitate to point it out for him, because he knows the frank criticism will help him. What we need is this type of genuine friendship.

title: Harmfulness of Video Games
body:
In spite of objections from public opinion, many students can't draw themselves away from video games. It seems that the more they are prohibited from playing the games, the more they are tempted to do so.

Many students indulge themselves in playing these games. Video games are harmful to both the individual and society in many ways. First, they endanger the young people's health. Sitting in front of the computer for hours on end is bad for the player's eyesight as well as his entire physique. Secondly, they distract the young people%attention from their work and study. Absorbed in the games, the player often forgets to go to work or class. Sometimes even if they are at work or in class, they are still thinking of the games they played or are going to play after work or after class. As a result, they quickly fall behind others in their work and study. Thirdly, they lead young people to moral degradation. Some young people are especially interested in games that are filled with violence. If they play these games a long time, they may also settle disagreements through violence, which may give rise to higher crime rate. Therefore, it is time we took effective measures to solve this problem.

On the one hand, young people should be made fully aware of the danger of video games. On the other, illegal video game houses should be eliminated, and software producers should be encouraged to make more beneficial video games in the future.
