title: Warm metal beads
body:
Finally, nervous and a little excited, he pressed a small, insignificant bump in the metal bead.Hollow out, the metal beads emit light heat and light from his palm, and a light appeared in front of him, TianHen intense gaze, but he was disappointed, because the light and shadow is fuzzy, besides can faintly see a lithe and graceful body jiao and the bright and beautiful eyes of deja vu, what other, can not tell the difference betweenIt was obvious that the woman wanted to hide her face from him.

"You're awake."The clear and moving voice came out, heard this voice Tianchen can not help swallowing mouth spit, "when you wake up, I have gone, rest assured, I know you have no money, all the expenses here I have paid.You can go anytime you want.One thing I want to make clear to you is that I did not choose you because I had a fancy for you, for reasons which I am sure you will soon find out.This is the end of the matter. From now on, do not seek me, and I will not appear before you.We don't have any relationship."

Hear here, day mark can not help but a leng, make what?A one-night stand?Are there any girls willing to give their first time in this situation?The feeling of being designed suddenly surges up in the heart, as the girl said in the message, which must have a certain reason.But he was also relieved that he had already paid for everything he had spent.Though the thoughts were rising in his head, the sound of the metal beads did not stop.

"You are a very interesting person, last night, you actually shouted a hundred and sixty-seven times I am not impotent, indeed, facts prove that you are not impotent, and, in that respect, you are very brave, although I have not seen others, but I am sure that you are not impotent.Good pull, I have to go, if because of last night's matter brought you any trouble, first say sorry, look at your appearance should be brokenhearted, but also humiliated, care what others say?If you want to live a happy life, just do what you want to do. No good thing will fall on you for no reason. If you want to get what you want, you must work hard.

title: Full blast
body:
If Sky mark is still awake at this time, will certainly be surprised from ear to ear.Three thousand galaxy currency means what, it means that a ting college students five years of tuition, such fees, even in the bustling Ting star also not many people can pay, after all, one hundred galaxy currency can make an ordinary family comfortably on a month.

In a moment jinka was back on her bright, wide-eyed hand. She stood up and walked over to Skymark. She took his arm and draped it over her shoulder.Go straight behind the city of Dreams.

...

In the groan, Tianchen slowly woke up, a severe headache to his mind is still a little fuzzy.The body is surrounded by a faint fragrance, surrounded by a soft, warm body, as if in the mother's warm embrace.

Ting comprehensive college experience to tianchen soon wake up, when he saw everything around, the first reaction, is from the soft bed jumped up.

Where is this?Why am I here?Looked at his body, in addition to the lower body some strange outside, and did not be beaten traces.Was it possible that last night the people of The city of Dreams not only did not pursue their debts, but gave themselves a beautiful woman to enjoy?The feeling of regret rose in the heart, the first time unexpectedly so no, he can not help but some of the feeling of whether to laugh or cry, soliloquize a way: "how should also let me feel a ah!What's the hurry?"

title: Priceless treasure
body:
The first thing that comes up is an empty scene.There, everything was empty but empty and empty, and he himself had a feeling that everything was empty.

There was no worry, no sadness, no joy, no laughter, nothing at all. Like a fetus in his mother's amniotic fluid, he had thoroughly experienced the meaning of the word "empty."

It's not spiritual emptiness, it's real...Empty.

I do not know how long later, a light appeared in the sky, as if the first ray of the rising sun, out of the endless "empty" born.

However, this ray of light from nothing is not plain sailing, it suddenly lit after, huo dim down, the whole world once again into the boundless darkness.

But the light soon reappeared, and that bright light drove out the darkness and revealed everything.

Then the light disappears and reappears and disappears and reappears.

Go round and round, it seems that every time disappear, appear is a reincarnation, and every experience a reincarnation, the strength of the light is more and more big, the final victory over the night, suddenly put bright, will all enveloped among them.

He Yiming's spirit seems to wake up at this moment, he is like a bystander like, stared at this strange change.As a young man, he had no idea what these changes meant.All he could be sure of was that he seemed to have stumbled upon something remarkable.

When the light seems to bloom forever, the darkness seems to know that it can no longer be devoid of light.But it did not leave, but clung to the light, and at last the two opposing forces formed a strange object.

In he Yiming's mind, there seems to be a bagua diagram of the two poles of Yin and Yang, especially in the center of the two poles, constantly rotating, as if trying to absorb everything.

There seemed to be a loud bang in his mind, and his spirit was absorbed without resistance.

The continuous rotation of the polar center faint out of many incredible images, and these images are constantly flashing in he Yiming's mind.

For a moment he seemed to be aloft, tens of thousands of feet in the air, feeling the heat of the sun, feeling the blastest blastments.He seemed to be in the depths of the sea, seeing the incredible beauty of the bottom, and feeling the terror of the surging waves, hundreds of meters high.

title: Under the moon
body:
He Yitao from the tree after the leap out, suddenly the body a short, at the foot of the force, like lightning toward he Yiming galloped, at the same time his hands hold the chest, with the help of the force before, will touch when he Yiming, suddenly forward hit out.

Although only eleven years old, but this one sprint strength and speed, are not to be underestimated.

However, in front of him he Yiming is a slight smile, seemingly casually stretched out two hands, gently in that full of power on the fist press once.

"Ouch..."

He Yitao screamed, the body in the air uncontrollable turn half a circle, the two circle hard hit the ground above.

For a time immediately is the soil splashed, especially the culprit he Yitao is swinging wrist, snow exhalation pain.

He Yiming slightly shook his head, see his body also splashed some soil, not from more depressed.

"Nine younger brother, you how come again this one move, this but I want to change clothes tomorrow, dirty and have to clean."

"Hey hey, six elder brother, I just want to try again yao."He Yitao shook his wrist again. Although his strength was not small, even his internal strength had reached a certain level, but his physical development could not be compared with adults after all. Although he would not be injured after a hard touch, the pain in a short time was inevitable.

"Hum, you did not break through to the fifth layer of internal strength, what to try."He Yiming dissatisfied with the way.

He Yitao blinked bright big eyes, suddenly asked: "six elder brother, do you feel the opportunity to break through?

title: An affair in the city of dreams
body:
His heart was cold, every time he thought about what he had just experienced, he could not help but sigh, "I am so poor, why this thing will fall on me, I, my virgin love so ended."He really seemed to cry out, I -- well -- but -- pity -- ah

In this colorful road, step by step towards the front, the body has been numb, he has even lost all sense, did not know where he came, or, where should go.Feet do not know by something mixed once, a stagger, immediately rushed to the ground, the uniform on the body was immediately contaminated with a little dust, Sky mark could not help but scold loudly, "I rely on, bad luck is really even fucking cold water blocked teeth.This must be my bad day."The brain is like missing a string like calculating today is the day of the week, secretly decided that this day will not go out easily.

Climb up, just wanted to go back to school, suddenly appeared in front of a dazzling ray of light, a shadow in front the TianHen, subconsciously looked up, in front of, is a face powder with a woman, the thick powder aroma to stimulate the sense of smell of the TianHen, twitching because rising in the heart, is this what the rich young man who said the streetwalkers lang?But his pocket is much cleaner than his face, or do not have ideas of good, what is more, in front of this seemingly beautiful woman, behind the powder only uncertain how old.Put a pair of eyebrow cold purpose appearance, cold sound way: "stem what?Escape."

The woman started obviously, and the cold voice made her heart tremble. She did not understand why such a voice should come from a young man's mouth, especially from his eyes, which seemed to see everything with shame.Some strange looked at the sky mark, but soon returned to normal, with an unnatural smile, the face that completely covered up the age of the thick powder slightly slipped, put a sexy posture, with the voice of self-provocative way: "Sir, you don't want to sit in our nightclub?You can get anything you want here."

Full of teasing noise to hear in the ears of Sky trace unspeakably tired, no money is really a painful thing ah!He suddenly noticed that the woman was looking at his left breast.Of course he knew what was there. There was the emblem of Zhongting College.

title: Silver uniform
body:
There was a rousing laugh. "Of course, we have all kinds of wine here, as you wish.There are many young people like you who come here to get drunk. Whatever you drink, we can satisfy you here. You are our God and our ruler.We treat every guest like a god."

Waved a wave, prevented the woman's speech, day mark dark below cruel, have no money have no money, advanced go to lane point that call wine thing drink point again, big deal be beaten.On weekdays he is some cowardly, but today in brokenhearted stimulation, do not know from where gush out a bold spirit, put the heart a horizontal, head up a way: "needless to say, take me in, I want to be able to make my anesthesia with the fastest speed of wine, of course, is also the best wine."

At this point, The sky mark has not to think about the consequences, his heart is still painful, four years of love, it is not so easy to put down.He wondered if his courage would have been so strong had he known that men had been maimed for freefall in The city of Dreams.

Woman heart exulting, flash to one side and the short of can't short skirt confide with the light of sensual, TianHen eyes flashing with a greedy, big ventured brushed on the women's legs, the woman a little mild chuckle and he didn't resist, but with his body, TianHen big feeling, heart beat faster, is his "first time" will end here?I hope you don't ask for money in the first place.With a perturbed mood under the guidance of the woman alive into the city of dreams.

All the noise, all the splendor, all the sky marks left no mark, he only knew that the very plump woman led him to a table for two and left.Although the heart of nostalgia just that kind of intoxicated feeling, but his vision was soon surrounded by many wearing "thin" beauty attracted

title: A pair of big bright eyes appeared before him
body:
"With me, with me?Tianchen's eyes were bright in front of him, which was the only thing he could tell."Well, drink it if you want.But I can't afford to pay for you, if you're not afraid of being shown the door."These were the last words of the day he could keep awake, for the next moment the green heat of the last two dreamy cups had swallowed most of his consciousness.

Big, bright eyes blinked. "No money?Interesting.No money also dare to drink the most expensive dream green, it seems that he really some special.Since you are already so decadent, you are not afraid to carry something else.Don't blame me."

The waiter dutifully took back the empty cup and served two more cups of dreamy green.Tianchen drank a cup, but another cup disappeared before his eyes.

The bright-eyed host stuck out her tongue and put her empty glass aside in a far more graceful gesture than Skyscar. "So strong, he drank four.Hey, I don't know your name?"

"Names, I -- I won't tell you.Or, if you answer me one question, I'll tell you."His stiff tongue made his voice a little hazy, but his bright eyes were still discerning."What is it?" she asked curiously.

Day mark fierce of caught her pair of ice-cold little hands, the vision have some dementia, "you tell me, am I impotent?"

"Yang, impotence?"The voice of her bright eyes suddenly rose an octave, and she did not know what to say to the handsome young man before her.

Sky trace self-deprecating smile, "yes!Impotence? That's what you must think, too.But I'm not impotent, I'm - not - Yang - impotent - "he roared at the top of his voice, which almost swept the hall where he was sitting, adding to the cacophony of contemptuous and curious glances.

title: metal texture
body:
Crystal cup of green liquid from a small bubble, the rich aroma is constantly pungent and come, hold the cup, slowly moved to his body before the day mark dull looking at the aroma of the green liquid, heart thought, this thing kiss up good, do not know how to drink, anyway, he also thirsty, to a happy bar.No longer hesitating, he closed his eyes, looked up, and a large cup of green liquor was poured down.

It was the first time in his life that he had drunk alcohol. Two crystal tears fell from the corners of his eyes at the same time as the liquor slid down his throat.They were not tears of pain, but stung by the pungency and heat."No wonder they all say wine is good, but it's so cool, even though it's a little bit cool.Let's have a good time today."

The hand that held the glass rose up, blue and white from overexerting itself, and the hot liquid did not melt the iceberg in his heart.But the scene before him was more dim, and the faintness of the faintest and the faintest invaded the recesses of his mind.

The thin walls of the crystal cup finally gave out a crisp sound that could not resist the grip of the sky mark.The shard of crystal slid down with bright red blood and fell to the ground with a tinkling sound."Depend, really unlucky day, this cup is what thing do, certainly is fake and inferior product."The angry way of day mark discontent, in fact, those rich people drink, and how many will be like him so?

title: Galactic Federation Council
body:
Tianxin originally in the ting Star ningding city, five years ago, he is now the most respected teacher from there to the ting city, joined the Ting college, now he is about to graduate, but today is in the pain of love.

As the largest comprehensive college in China, China Titing Comprehensive College is generally only accessible to the children of the rich and is located in the capital city of China Titing City.The woman in front of him had obviously treated him as a guest inlaid with a gentleman's badge, Tianchen thought.Unfortunately, she is not the kind of rich people in her imagination, if she knew that she is just a slum out, just because of excellent flying performance was specially recruited into the Ting College, I am afraid that will completely change to a kind of attitude.At this moment, Sky Trace was suddenly filled with hatred, as if everything in the world were the object of his hatred.In the heart dark scold, money, really fucking is not a good thing, but without money, it is absolutely can't ah!

He lifted his head and looked up at the sky, skimming over the woman's body. Streams of light kept flashing through the sky. It was a flying vehicle, the most common flying vehicle of the Galactic Federation, except for various aircraft and warships used to travel between the stars.Not only in this star, almost the entire Galactic alliance has used flying cars as a means of transport, there are many types of flying cars, but it is not the sky mark from the slums of the young people can understand, because they are rich people's playthings.He just knows that the expensive cars in the parking lot of The Zhongting College are the tools that the rich kids compete with to show off.At the same time, he knew that he could fly as fast as the most ordinary flying car, and that was all he could be proud of.He often told himself that his body was the best car, and of course this was the only thing he could comfort himself with.Really advanced flying cars can travel at almost a thousand meters per second, which is three or four times more than the speed of sound.What's more, sitting in a flying car is enjoyable, while flying with space gas is a hard thing.At least, the safety of people flying cars is much stronger than physical flight.

title: Internal work secret
body:
Know the internal work secret book has a variety of attributes, if can practice to the main attributes of the human body corresponding to the secret book, natural progress can be such as flying, but if the selection of secret book is not right, so it is likely that what also practice not out.For the first time, he Yiming was able to choose the internal work secret book corresponding to the attributes of his body, which was definitely a lucky thing to the extreme.

In the following three years, he Yiming every one or two years old, a hurdle, nine years old, has been promoted to the fifth tier of mixed yuan jin.

But after this, he Yiming met everyone will have some practice wall obstacles, and in this pass on a card is a full four years.

During these four years two brothers, sister, and cousin of the family had overtaken him to the fifth degree, and even his sister and the cousin had reached the fourth.But he was standing still, no matter how hard he worked, he just couldn't get any further.

Of course, of the nine third-generation siblings, only the eldest and grandchild reached the seventh level, the second and third reached the sixth level, and the rest of the family hung around the fifth or fourth level.

But he yiming, who reached the fifth level at the age of nine and then showed no signs of progress for four years, is unique.

Gently sighed one breath, he Yiming slowly stand straight, in the moonlight under the shining, that young body was wearing a trace of loneliness that could not be said.

He Yitao spit out his tongue, but his progress is orderly, unlike six elder brother, as a child in a few brothers, known as to be able to stand shoulder to shoulder with the elder brother, or even to surpass the elder brother's genius is expected to experience.So he absolutely can't understand he Yiming's distress at the moment.

title: Bitcoin Bull Market Has Plenty Steam Left, Indicators Suggests
body:
Bitcoin has risen over 40% this month, reaching a new record price of $66,879 on expectations that the recently listed ProShares exchange-traded fund (ETF) tied to the cryptocurrencyâ€™s futures would bring more mainstream money into the market.

Such a steep ascent often has investors assessing whether the party is coming to a close, especially when popular technical indicators like the relative strength index (RSI) signal overbought conditions, as with bitcoin.

However, blockchain metrics like the MVRV Z-score and a lesser-known chart-based indicator, Mayer Multiple, suggest the bull run has plenty of steam left.

The market value-to-realized value (MVRV) Z-score that measures the deviation of market value from realized value and is used to assess undervalued and overvalued conditions, has doubled to 3.91 this month. However, the value is nowhere close to the red zone above 5.00 that has historically marked the final leg of the bull market.

The market value represents the total network value of the cryptocurrency and is calculated by multiplying the total circulating supply by the last traded price. Meanwhile, the realized value is calculated by valuing each coin at the price it was last moved.

Although bitcoin market valuations may not be cheap, they do not appear to be overstretched either, with there being a scope for an extension of the price rally.

â€œWhen market value is significantly higher than realized value, it has historically indicated a market top (red zone), while the opposite has indicated market bottoms (green zone),â€ blockchain analytics firm [Glassnode said](https://academy.glassnode.com/market/mvrv/mvrv-z-score) in the MVRV Z-score explainer.

title: Bitcoinâ€™s Inflation Narrative More Compelling Than ETF Fever, JPM Says
body:
This weekâ€™s launch of the ProShares Bitcoin Strategy Exchange-Traded Fund (BITO) may have aided the cryptocurrencyâ€™s recent price surge to an all-time high, though the perception of bitcoin as an inflation hedge over gold is probably a bigger factor, a JPMorgan strategist wrote Thursday.

* In its first two days of trading, BITO amassed assets of over $1 billion, according to ProShares.
* Bloomberg ETF analyst Eric Balchunas says the new ProShares fund is the [fastest](https://twitter.com/EricBalchunas/status/1451215742238609415) in the history of the ETF industry to reach $1 billion in two sessions; such an ascent eclipsed the SPDR Gold Trust (GLD) ETFâ€™s 18-year record at three days to reach this level.
* JPMorgan strategist Nikolaos Panigirtzoglou wrote in a note to clients that thereâ€™s been a shift from gold ETFs into bitcoin funds since September, and there are already existing vehicles for investors to gain bitcoin exposure; the bank sees this shift in flows being bullish for bitcoin into year-end.
* BITO saw trading volume of over 29 million shares Wednesday, representing over $1.2 billion, according to a representative from the company.
* Separately, billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones [told](https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/20/paul-tudor-jones-says-crypto-is-his-preferred-inflation-hedge-over-gold-right-now.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=tk&cdlcid=5f2b29166be319c3c3a71176) CNBC earlier this week he currently prefers bitcoin over gold as an inflation hedge.

title: Bitcoin Price Flash Crash on Binance.US Attributed to Trader Algorithm Bug
body:
Bitcoinâ€™s price briefly crashed 87% and then recovered within the span of a single minute early Thursday on [Binance.US](http://binance.us/), in a fleeting but very real flash crash that the cryptocurrency exchange attributed to a â€œbugâ€ in an institutional customerâ€™s trading algorithm.

At 11:34 UTC (7:34 a.m. ET), the price fell from around $65,760 to as low as $8,200, then quickly bounced back up to almost exactly where it was before.

â€œOne of our institutional traders indicated to us that they had a bug in their trading algorithm, which appears to have caused the sell-off that was reported this morning,â€ a [Binance.US](http://binance.us/) spokesperson told CoinDesk.

â€œWe are continuing to look into the event but understand from the trader that they have now fixed their bug and that the issue appears to have been resolved,â€ the spokesperson said, declined to comment on further details about the crash.

On other cryptocurrency exchanges, bitcoinâ€™s price dropped around the same time, but by nowhere near as much. On Bitstamp, for example, the price fell about 2.3% at 11:34 UTC but never got below $63,600.

Then thereâ€™s the market news, which changes every day. But still, a futures-based ETF differs from a physically backed ETF and will likely benefit traders more than passive investors, Matt Hougan of [Bitwise](https://www.bitwiseinvestments.com/) told CoinDeskâ€™s Emily Parker [last week](https://www.coindesk.com/tv/first-mover/first-mover-october-15-2021/). title: So is crypto a passive investment?
body:
Crypto is therefore seen as [an investment](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/14/how-should-you-treat-crypto-compared-with-other-assets-in-a-portfolio/). But is it a passive one? Most financial planners say no, citing impossible-to-predict liquidity and growth. Even though bitcoin reached a [new all-time high](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/20/bitcoin-hits-new-all-time-high-above-65k-as-etf-goes-live/) this week during the optimistic [futures ETF buzz](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/19/what-to-make-of-the-first-bitcoin-futures-etf-launch/), some planners are giving it time to see if its value will continue climbing amid all the inevitable changes ahead.

Sentiment can do more than make investors weary: It can also influence markets, points out [Lazetta Rainey Braxton](https://www.lazetta.com/), a New York-based certified financial planner and co-founder.

â€œWhen China said no to crypto, all of \[the crypto values\] tanked,â€ Braxton says, referring to the countryâ€™s [recent crypto crackdown](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/09/27/3-takes-about-chinas-crypto-ban-that-are-wrong/).

Therefore, Braxton recommends to her clients to cover all of the basics before getting into crypto: having a robust emergency fund, a retirement account such as a 401(k) or IRA (or both), and a passive brokerage account comprising index funds and ETFs.

Clientsâ€™ crypto money can then be their â€œplay money,â€ says Braxton, who recommends to her clients they max out their crypto investments at only 5% of their portfolios.

While Braxtonâ€™s advice is common among financial planners, who understandably must protect their clientsâ€™ money and mitigate risk, it also helps to zoom out and help your clients understand the unique value they personally see in owning and/or using cryptocurrency.

title: Access and value
body:
Self-directed retail investors are able to access crypto easily, Hougan said, and have been for the past eight years. But advisors arenâ€™t yet allocating their clientsâ€™ portfolios to the currency because thereâ€™s [not yet a regulatory structure](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/14/how-should-you-treat-crypto-compared-with-other-assets-in-a-portfolio/) that lets them do so easily. It will be a while, it seems, before many advisors recommend crypto as anything more than a speculative investment.

â€œUnlike a dollar, the value of bitcoin \[or crypto\] can vary greatly on a day-to-day basis,â€ says Nashville-based certified financial planner [Jeanne Fisher](https://www.linkedin.com/in/401klady/). This [volatility](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/14/if-crypto-causes-instability-its-because-the-system-is-unstable/) is enough to make financial planners and advisors keep the blinders on and stick to the basic investment recommendations of Roth IRAs, no-fuss index funds and low-cost ETFs.

Yet, as Texas-based certified financial planner Morgen Rochard pointed out in an issue of the [Crypto for Advisors newsletter](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-for-advisors/) last month, bitcoin has the [highest risk-adjusted returns](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2021/09/30/why-bitcoin-has-value-and-should-be-part-of-your-clients-portfolio/) according to the Sharpe ratio.

The built-in scarcity of bitcoin in particular â€“ along with its verifiability, portability, and durability â€“ makes it one of the most historically deflationary types of currencies weâ€™ve seen, argued Rochard. Unlike putting cash into a typical savings account, or even a high-yield account that earns clients 1% to 2%, storing cash as crypto is arguably easier and more potentially lucrative.

title: Conceptualizing crypto for clients
body:
Earlier this month, Adam Blumberg, a certified financial planner and founder of the cryptocurrency education company Interaxis, outlined [three ways you can conceptualize an investment in](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/07/revolution-macro-and-micro-three-ways-to-look-at-a-bitcoin-investment/) bitcoin in particular for clients: As an economic revolution, as a macro investment (a way large funds and governments can protect value amid global economic influences), and as a micro investment â€“ meaning, for the average person.

Identifying these areas will help your clients begin to see where they fit into the global picture and decide whether to wait for more [passive crypto investing options](https://www.coindesk.com/learn/top-6-crypto-passive-income-generators-for-2021/) coming one day, or to tighten up their financial foundation and prepare to take part now.

title: Futures-based ETF vs. â€˜physicalâ€™ ETF
body:
As of Oct. 19, the SEC approved a [futures-based ETF](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/19/what-to-make-of-the-first-bitcoin-futures-etf-launch/) and the first fund (BITO, by ProShares) [began trading](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/19/bitcoin-hits-6-month-high-as-first-bitcoin-futures-etf-bito-starts-trading/). The fund had an astounding nearly $1 billion of volume in the [first day of trading](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/19/first-bitcoin-futures-etf-bito-nears-1b-trading-volume-on-first-day/). To put this in perspective, this is the highest first-day organic volume seen in ETF history.

Bitcoin futures held by a fund create interesting problems, however. For example, if the bitcoin futures curve is in â€œ[contango](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/20/contango-conmigo-why-a-bitcoin-futures-etf-could-be-a-bloody-ride/)â€ (the out-months are trading at a higher price than the front-months), this is equivalent to selling low and buying high. When futures are held in an ETF, they must be rolled at the end of each month. This creates what is called a negative roll yield â€“ creating a decay in terms of return.

What this really boils down to is that a futures-based ETF will have a difficult time tracking the spot bitcoin price, and it will be an expensive way for advisors to allocate to bitcoin for their clients. But it might be the easiest option for quite a while.

â€œOne of the main benefits of a futures-based ETF is that the futures are cash settled. Thereâ€™s no custody. So, if the SEC has any issues around custody with bitcoin itself, that wonâ€™t be a concern with a futures-based bitcoin ETF,â€ according to Nate Geraci.

A â€œphysicalâ€ ETF, however, does not have the same problems as a futures-based solution. While crypto trading, custody and reporting is more expensive than traditional finance, a physical bitcoin ETF will not have the same drag as a futures-based ETF. We can certainly expect a physical bitcoin ETF to be more expensive than most ETFs on the market, but likely cheaper than a futures-based ETF.

We can also expect a physical bitcoin ETF to track the spot bitcoin price more accurately than a futures-based ETF. Companies like Grayscale, which currently offers the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC), have [filed to convert to the ETF structure](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/17/grayscale-said-close-to-filing-to-convert-bitcoin-fund-into-spot-etf-cnbc-says/). \[*Editorâ€™s note: Grayscale is owned by Digital Currency Group, the parent company of CoinDesk.*\] GBTC currently trades at a -20% discount to the spot bitcoin price, a phenomenon that many ETF experts believe will go to 0% upon ETF conversion.

Nate Geraci, for example, believes that we will not see a physical bitcoin ETF approved until the second half of 2022 at the earliest â€“ and I agree with him. This is unfortunate because there is obviously demand for a physical bitcoin ETF.

title: Seizure resistance
body:
Bitcoin is difficult to confiscate. Not impossible, but difficult. It requires the would-be confiscator to get ahold of the cryptographic private keys to a bitcoin wallet, which in turn requires the cooperation of the keyholder (assuming the person has properly secured his or her keys).

That helps explain bitcoinâ€™s appeal to [people living under repressive regimes](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2020/12/08/bitcoin-dissidents-those-who-need-it-most/), and [even in the West](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/04/05/satoshis-birthday-april-5-is-a-day-to-be-thankful-for-bitcoin/) there are edge cases where this quality could prove advantageous â€“ say, by preventing a prosecutor from unilaterally freezing all a defendantâ€™s assets [before the person has been convicted of a crime](https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424127887324110404578630561814823892) (a practice that leaves the accused unable to pay for the counsel of their choice).

Iâ€™ve quoted [Nathan Cook](https://twitter.com/topynate), now CTO of Zen Protocol Development, on this point [before](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2017/11/14/ill-give-you-my-bitcoin-when-you-pry-it-from-my-cold-dead-hands/), but I canâ€™t improve on his wonderful passage [from 2015](https://topynate.wordpress.com/2016/01/14/bitcoin-reifies-an-old-post/), so here it is again:

*An owner of bitcoin no longer has the problem faced by the owner of any other transferable asset: â€˜Will my property rights be respected?â€™ Holders of bitcoin own it in virtue of material facts independent of their social relations. The world may turn its back on bitcoin, yea, its value may fall to fractions of a cent, but those who own it will own it regardless.*

title: Scarcity amid inflation
body:
Bitcoin has a capped supply and a predictable schedule of issuance: 6.25 BTC are mined every 10 minutes, and that amount is cut in half every four years or so and will continue to be halved until the supply reaches a hair under 21 million units sometime in 2140, when weâ€™re all dead (except maybe [Peter Thiel](https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/21/silicon-valleys-quest-to-live-forever-could-benefit-the-rest-of-us.html), God bless him). After that, no more bitcoin will ever be created unless the algorithm in the software is changed by a consensus of the network, which is theoretically possible but exceedingly unlikely because it would go against the interests of pretty much everyone involved (miners, users, developers).

As such, some investors look at bitcoin as a hedge against inflation, a role traditionally played by gold. Arguably, bitcoin is even scarcer than gold because you never know when someoneâ€™s going to dig up some shiny rocks from the ground or [from an asteroid](https://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/51858259), whereas we know with near certainty how much bitcoin will exist at any given time.

The lazier critics like to point out that there are thousands of other cryptocurrencies with similar characteristics as bitcoin, and claim this means the original is not scarce at all. Anyone who tells you this has not done their homework.

As a first mover, bitcoin has network effects on its side. It has far and above the highest hashrate, or level of computing power devoted to securing the network, among those cryptos that use proof-of-work, a mechanism by which participants agree on which set of records is true. For this reason, bitcoin at the network level is (almost) impossible to hack (centralized exchanges are another story) and arguably the most secure coin in the most secure category. There are other consensus mechanisms, such as [proof-of-stake](https://www.coindesk.com/learn/2020/12/30/what-is-proof-of-stake/), but none has been tested to the degree proof-of-work has.

Thatâ€™s not to say other cryptos canâ€™t have value, but thereâ€™s a reason bitcoin to this day still has the highest market capitalization among cryptos despite the proliferation of challengers, and itâ€™s not just name recognition.

Long story short, if itâ€™s not bitcoin itâ€™s not bitcoin, and there will almost certainly never be more than just under 21 million of them.

Compare that to the U.S. M2 money supply, [also hitting all-time highs](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/M2SL), with no constraints other than the restraint of Washington policymakers, and consider all this in light of recent [headlines about inflation](https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/20/paul-tudor-jones-says-inflation-could-be-worse-than-feared-biggest-threat-to-markets-and-society.html).

There are [smart people](https://twitter.com/thestalwart/status/1242407521295503360?lang=en) who argue the extraordinary measures the U.S. Federal Reserve took in response to the 2008 global financial crisis and later the coronavirus pandemic arenâ€™t really â€œmoney printingâ€ and that the recent increases in consumer prices are due to supply chain bottlenecks and therefore [temporary](https://www.reuters.com/breakingviews/transitory-inflation-is-fig-leaf-thats-slipping-2021-09-23/).

Maybe theyâ€™re right. You can think of bitcoin as insurance against the possibility theyâ€™re wrong.

That is worth *something*.

title: Conceptualizing crypto for clients
body:
Earlier this month, Adam Blumberg, a certified financial planner and founder of the cryptocurrency education company Interaxis, outlined [three ways you can conceptualize an investment in](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/07/revolution-macro-and-micro-three-ways-to-look-at-a-bitcoin-investment/) bitcoin in particular for clients: As an economic revolution, as a macro investment (a way large funds and governments can protect value amid global economic influences), and as a micro investment â€“ meaning, for the average person.

Identifying these areas will help your clients begin to see where they fit into the global picture and decide whether to wait for more [passive crypto investing options](https://www.coindesk.com/learn/top-6-crypto-passive-income-generators-for-2021/) coming one day, or to tighten up their financial foundation and prepare to take part now.

And if your clients are ready to begin using bitcoin and/or other cryptocurrencies to diversify their portfolios today, be sure to understand the [10 things every beginner crypto investor should know](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/05/10/buying-your-first-crypto-10-things-you-should-know/).

title: Pros weigh in
body:
Professional traders who spoke to CoinDesk are not sure why the meme coin is showing such resiliency.

A comparison of SHIB to its predecessor, DOGE, is even more stunning: SHIBâ€™s merely 23% down from its peak in May, according to CoinGecko. DOGE, perhaps the most well-known and popular of the dog coins, is down by more than 68% from its top in May.

â€œSHIB is like this â€˜retail-traders-take-over-the-worldâ€™ magic tokenâ€ that has gained a strong base, an active SHIB community member who goes by the name â€œDarrenâ€ told CoinDesk via WeChat. He added that many of the SHIB holders do not track bitcoinâ€™s ups and downs, so itâ€™s hard to pin SHIBâ€™s moves on that of other cryptocurrencies.

The coinâ€™s strong retail user base is also reflected on social media platforms, according to Du Jun, co-founder of crypto exchange Huobi, who pointed out that SHIBâ€™s official Twitter account has more than 1.1 million followers, a higher number than most of other crypto projects.

â€œShiba inu has a strong user base and its projects are relatively simple and easy to understand for crypto beginners,â€ Du said.

During the past summer when SHIBâ€™s performance was more lackluster, unique addresses for SHIB also managed to continue to grow, per data from Nansen. There are over 750,000 unique addresses holding SHIB as of Oct. 11, more than doubled from May 10 when its price hit an all-time high.

â€œPrice slides havenâ€™t deterred new entrants who think SHIB can go much higher since it is relatively very cheap, especially when compared to DOGE, which it emulates and aims to surpass,â€ Hunain Naseer, senior editor at OKExInsights, said.

title: So is crypto a passive investment?
body:
Crypto is therefore seen as [an investment](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/14/how-should-you-treat-crypto-compared-with-other-assets-in-a-portfolio/). But is it a passive one? Most financial planners say no, citing impossible-to-predict liquidity and growth. Even though bitcoin reached a [new all-time high](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/20/bitcoin-hits-new-all-time-high-above-65k-as-etf-goes-live/) this week during the optimistic [futures ETF buzz](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/19/what-to-make-of-the-first-bitcoin-futures-etf-launch/), some planners are giving it time to see if its value will continue climbing amid all the inevitable changes ahead.

Sentiment can do more than make investors weary: It can also influence markets, points out [Lazetta Rainey Braxton](https://www.lazetta.com/), a New York-based certified financial planner and co-founder.

â€œWhen China said no to crypto, all of \[the crypto values\] tanked,â€ Braxton says, referring to the countryâ€™s [recent crypto crackdown](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/09/27/3-takes-about-chinas-crypto-ban-that-are-wrong/).

Therefore, Braxton recommends to her clients to cover all of the basics before getting into crypto: having a robust emergency fund, a retirement account such as a 401(k) or IRA (or both), and a passive brokerage account comprising index funds and ETFs.

Clientsâ€™ crypto money can then be their â€œplay money,â€ says Braxton, who recommends to her clients they max out their crypto investments at only 5% of their portfolios.

While Braxtonâ€™s advice is common among financial planners, who understandably must protect their clientsâ€™ money and mitigate risk, it also helps to zoom out and help your clients understand the unique value they personally see in owning and/or using cryptocurrency.

title: How Does Crypto Fit Into a Passive Investment Strategy?
body:
Until recently, there has been little thatâ€™s passive about cryptocurrency. From the get-go, buying bitcoin or alternative coins (altcoins) requires research â€“ at least enough to open a [digital wallet](https://www.coindesk.com/learn/how-to-store-your-bitcoin/) or app that [lets your clients buy cryptocurrency](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2021/08/26/crypto-for-advisors-your-clients-may-already-own-crypto-heres-how-to-hold-it/), such as Robinhood, CashApp or Venmo.

Then thereâ€™s the market news, which changes every day. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has made significant strides in the conversation about regulating the $2 trillion asset class â€“ including [approving a bitcoin futures exchange-traded fund](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/15/sec-approves-bitcoin-etf-opening-crypto-to-wider-investor-base/) (ETF) to [begin trading this week](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2021/10/18/proshares-etf-to-start-nyse-trading-on-tuesday-report/).

***This article originally appeared inÂ [Crypto for Advisors](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-for-advisors/), CoinDeskâ€™s new weekly newsletter defining crypto, digital assets and the future of finance.Â [Sign up here](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-for-advisors/)Â to receive it every Thursday.***

But still, a futures-based ETF differs from a physically backed ETF and will likely benefit traders more than passive investors, Matt Hougan of [Bitwise](https://www.bitwiseinvestments.com/) told CoinDeskâ€™s Emily Parker [last week](https://www.coindesk.com/tv/first-mover/first-mover-october-15-2021/). According to Hougan, the futures-based bitcoin ETF is part of the SECâ€™s â€œcrawl, walk, runâ€ approach to opening up the growing crypto market to everyday investors.

title: Bitcoin Holds Above $66K, but Elevated Funding Rates Call for Caution
body:
Bitcoin remains on the offensive, thanks to ProShares futures-focused Bitcoin Strategy ETFâ€™s strong debut on the New York Stock Exchange earlier this week. The cryptocurrency bounced to $66,400, having found bids near $64,000 during the Asian hours.

0 seconds of 4 minutes, 53 secondsVolume 90%

* [Analysts foresee](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/20/bitcoin-all-time-high-breakout-could-target-86k-price-charts-suggest/) a rally toward $86,000 in the coming weeks. However, it may not be a smooth ride, as the derivatives market is beginning to show signs of overheating â€“ often a recipe for price pullbacks.
* Bitcoinâ€™s average funding rate or the cost of holding long positions in the perpetual futures listed on major exchanges, including Binance, has risen to 0.06% â€“ the highest in at least six months, according to data provided by Bybit. Exchanges calculate funding rates every eight hours.
* On retail-focused exchange Bybit, the funding rate surged as high as 0.14% early today.
* â€œParticipants need to pay close attention to the exchange funding rates represented by Bybit, where retail investors are more concentrated, and excessive rates may trigger another short-term price downturn,â€ Babel Finance mentioned in the weekly research note published Monday.
* While funding rates seen at press time are significantly higher than those seen before the early September sell-off and the mid-May price crash, they are not yet as high as the ones seen during the first quarter bull frenzy.
* Although a positive funding rate represents an upbeat market mood, a very high reading indicates that the leverage is heavily skewed on the bullish side and often paves the way for price pullbacks.
* Stack Funds COO and co-founder Matthew Dibb said elevated funding rates might inject volatility into the market. â€œOur expectation is that capital will rotate into ethereum and major altcoins while bitcoin cools off slightly,â€ Dibb added.

title: Bitcoin Mining Is Decentralizing â€“ Hereâ€™s Proof
body:
Thereâ€™s at least one industry where the United States now has China beat: bitcoin mining.

After Beijingâ€™s crackdown on crypto in September, the U.S. took the reins as the leading location for bitcoin mining, according to[ data compiled by the Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance](https://www.jbs.cam.ac.uk/insight/2021/geographic-shift/) and released last week. Just two years ago, China accounted for three-quarters of all of bitcoinâ€™s total hashrate (the computational power used to mine bitcoin), while the U.S. contributed a scant 4%. As of August, Chinaâ€™s bitcoin miners were gone, while the Americans were responsible for 35%.

***Youâ€™re reading [Crypto Long & Short](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-long-short/), our weekly newsletter featuring insights, news and analysis for the professional investor. [Sign up here](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-long-short/) to get it in your inbox every Sunday.***

A recurring criticism of bitcoin mining in the past was that so much of it came from

China. So long as that was the case, the more extreme arguments said, the Chinese government could somehow pressure miners to do its bidding. Whether that was the case is now moot because that government rescinded any opportunity to do so by kicking its miners out of the country.

Adding Kazakhstanâ€™s 18% with the U.S.â€™s 35% means that more than half of all bitcoin mining is happening in just two countries. That may seem like bitcoin is pretty much as concentrated as it was when China was the dominant player, but one index is showing that concentration has declined significantly with Chinaâ€™s exit.

title: Why Shiba Inu Has Been More Resilient Than Some SHIB Haters Would Like to Admit
body:
The world knows a thing or two about SHIBArmy, the community behind the self-proclaimed dogecoin killer shiba inu (SHIB). But does it know how powerful SHIBArmy can be?

SHIB, the token thatâ€™s clearly not taken seriously by most institutional investors, is still far from dead after another dumping event last week. Blockchain data reveals a tale of how small, individual investors can go against big institutions when they are united.

Since Monday, the SHIB community has been celebrating the survival of last Thursdayâ€™s bloody dump across social media platforms: â€œShiba Inu rebounds 40% despite major selling by SHIB whales,â€ a Shiba Inu Telegram group posted on Tuesday under the title â€œWhales are NOT in control of Shiba.â€ The message has since been circulating in many Telegram groups.

â€œWe are Shiba The Doge Killer,â€ the message ended.

## SHIB by the numbers

The whale dump mentioned in the message, according to blockchain data firm Santiment, took place on Thursday.

Thatâ€™s when about 31.07 billion SHIB were shed from addresses that held 1 million to 10 million SHIB, wiping out 3.02% of all addresses with SHIB holding within the range. (For clarityâ€™s sake, 1 million to 10 million SHIB is worth $27 to $272 at current prices.)

Santiment also captured a significant uptick in both active deposits and exchange inflow of SHIB at the time.

To be fair, with SHIBâ€™s price still far below $1, the aforementioned message from Tuesday decrying the influence of SHIB whales isnâ€™t fully supported. The top 10 SHIB addresses hold more than 78% of the total SHIB supply and barely moved any SHIB during the time period in question, according to Santiment data.

But nevertheless, the impact of such collective dumping among small SHIB traders is obvious: Last Thursday, the biggest dump so far, SHIBâ€™s price dropped by more than $17% on the day, according to data from TradingView and Binance.

At press time, SHIB was changing hands at $0.00002727, up 34.4% from its latest dump.

title: Letâ€™s get HHI
body:
The [Herfindahlâ€“Hirschman Index (HHI) ](https://www.justice.gov/atr/horizontal-merger-guidelines-08192010)is often used by the U.S. Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission to determine the concentration of an industry. The higher the index, the more control of that industry is in the hands of a few players. Itâ€™s calculated by adding up the squares of an individual companyâ€™s market share (after multiplying each by 100). Doing so amplifies the weight of those firms with larger market shares.

The DOJ puts markets into three buckets based on their HHI score:

* Unconcentrated Markets: HHI below 1,500
* Moderately Concentrated Markets: HHI between 1,500 and 2,500
* Highly Concentrated Markets: HHI above 2,500

The regulators use this as a tool to determine whether to greenlight a merger or acquisition. If combining the two companies would raise the HHI by more than 100 points in a moderately concentrated market, that could raise red flags. Doing so in a highly concentrated market significantly decreases the chances such an M&A deal will go through.

## Using it for countries? Are you HHI?

HHI is generally used to look at companies in an industry. Applying it to country market share isnâ€™t quite the same thing. After all, within each country many firms could be vigorously competing for their tiny slivers of the overall market share. And one firm could have facilities in multiple countries, making this even more an apples-to-oranges comparison.

Nonetheless, coming up with an HHI figure for how concentrated bitcoin mining is by country does give some insight into whether bitcoin mining is as diversified as it should be if itâ€™s to survive the whims of any one governmentâ€™s capriciousness.

As it turns out, the market as it pertains to hashrate after Chinaâ€™s crackdown is now down to â€œmoderately concentrated,â€ down from â€œhighly concentrated,â€ if one were to use the DOJâ€™s measures.

Back in September 2019, the HHI using just the top nine countries was an astounding 5,774 because Chinaâ€™s share was 76%. A year later, it was down to 4,637, with Chinaâ€™s share falling to 67%. While lower, that is still a number that would make a trustbuster apoplectic.

Interestingly, a major falloff happened in Q3 of 2020. Thatâ€™s when China made it[ harder for miners to use over-the-counter trading desks](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2020/11/16/chinas-crypto-miners-struggle-to-pay-power-bills-as-regulators-clamp-down-on-otc-desks/) to sell their product. In November of that year, Chinaâ€™s share of hashrate fell to 56% and the HHI of the top nine countries hit 3,306. Again, thatâ€™s still highly concentrated.

Yet, now with China out of the picture â€“ at least on paper (â€While there are certainly ongoing covert mining operations in China, those would have to be small-scale to avoid scrutiny,â€ [tweeted CCAFâ€™s Michel Rauch](https://twitter.com/mrauchs/status/1448668085255290880?s=20)) â€“ the HHI has fallen to â€œmoderately concentratedâ€ territory. The top nine countries produced an HHI of 1,871 in August, based on the most recent data available.

For those who wonder about the rest of the world besides the top nine, their hashrate in total never amounted to more than 9.4% (and that was in August), contributing just 89 points at the most if one were to lump them all together.

title: Access and value
body:
Self-directed retail investors are able to access crypto easily, Hougan said, and have been for the past eight years. But advisors arenâ€™t yet allocating their clientsâ€™ portfolios to the currency because thereâ€™s [not yet a regulatory structure](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/14/how-should-you-treat-crypto-compared-with-other-assets-in-a-portfolio/) that lets them do so easily. It will be a while, it seems, before many advisors recommend crypto as anything more than a speculative investment.

â€œUnlike a dollar, the value of bitcoin \[or crypto\] can vary greatly on a day-to-day basis,â€ says Nashville-based certified financial planner [Jeanne Fisher](https://www.linkedin.com/in/401klady/). This [volatility](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/14/if-crypto-causes-instability-its-because-the-system-is-unstable/) is enough to make financial planners and advisors keep the blinders on and stick to the basic investment recommendations of Roth IRAs, no-fuss index funds and low-cost ETFs.

Yet, as Texas-based certified financial planner Morgen Rochard pointed out in an issue of the [Crypto for Advisors newsletter](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-for-advisors/) last month, bitcoin has the [highest risk-adjusted returns](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2021/09/30/why-bitcoin-has-value-and-should-be-part-of-your-clients-portfolio/) according to the Sharpe ratio.

The built-in scarcity of bitcoin in particular â€“ along with its verifiability, portability, and durability â€“ makes it one of the most historically deflationary types of currencies weâ€™ve seen, argued Rochard. Unlike putting cash into a typical savings account, or even a high-yield account that earns clients 1% to 2%, storing cash as crypto is arguably easier and more potentially lucrative.

Shagru regained his composure and made a slight movement of his head. The palace steward immediately closed the door, pressed his face against it, and turned his back to the room, so that he stood against the door.

After arranging her messy long hair, she took out a small sandalwood fan and fanned it easily, as if she were a lady.

The eyes of the four courtiers lit up. Wasn't this beautiful woman, so beautiful that she dropped a drip of honey, the wife of the Duke of Greene, the great Lord near the southern border?

title: Why Binance?
body:
A buyer with a long-term perspective would usually try to avoid buying a large amount of bitcoin on one exchange in a short period of time, in order to mitigate the risk of [slippage](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/slippage.asp). The more appealing approach for large purchases is usually the over-the-counter (OTC) market.

When the OTC market cannot source more bitcoin, traders could turn to exchanges for new supply. But as independent analyst Willy Woo told CoinDesk, OTC desks usually outsource bitcoin through [algorithmic trading](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/active-trading/101014/basics-algorithmic-trading-concepts-and-examples.asp) programs with tools including [volume weighted average price ](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/trading/11/trading-with-vwap-mvwap.asp)(VWAP) to break down the order into positions across all exchanges. It is unlikely that an OTC desk would conduct a large transaction at once on one exchange and cause a significant price movement.

The Oct. 6 purchase of $1.6 billion worth bitcoin using USDT [happened on an exchange with ties to China](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/10/who-bought-16b-in-bitcoin-wednesday-and-why/) in the middle of a week of severe uncertainty in the country as several real estate borrowers were defaulting on loan payments.

However, as China doubled down on its ban on crypto trading and [the most popular bull narrative](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/18/cme-sees-record-open-interest-in-bitcoin-futures-ahead-of-etf-debut/) appears to be the hype around the SECâ€™s approval of a bitcoin futures-based ETF, some argue that the seemingly strange move on Binance had less to do with Chinaâ€™s crypto investors.

â€œBinance does not simply represent the market in Asia now,â€ said Alex Zuo, vice president of Singapore-based crypto wallet company Cobo. â€œItâ€™s hard to make the connection between Asia and the recent price rally.â€

The reason that the â€œabnormalâ€ activity took place on Binance in particular could be that Binanceâ€™s BTC/USDT trading pair is highly liquid, according to Zuo.

He added that whales in Asia do not appear to be in a rush to dump their USDT after [a story on Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-10-07/crypto-mystery-where-s-the-69-billion-backing-the-stablecoin-tether) indicated that the reserves of Tether Holdings, the company behind USDT, included â€œbillions of dollars of short-term loans to large Chinese companies.â€

Last weekâ€™s news that [Bitfinex and Tether settled charges with U.S. regulators](https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2021/10/15/cftc-fines-tether-and-bitfinex-425m-for-untrue-or-misleading-claims/) for a more than $42 million fine is even seen as â€œbullishâ€ to many large USDT holders, Zuo said, as it removes uncertainty.

James Check, an analyst from blockchain data firm Glassnode, suggested that the latest rally is purely caused by more bitcoin demand than supply.

â€œIâ€™m not really ever focused on which venue the buying occurs because I simply donâ€™t think it is useful information,â€ he said.

title: Demand Spike on Binance Played Key Role in Bitcoin Rally: Kaiko
body:
Bitcoinâ€™s steady march to near-all time highs came as traders correctly anticipated that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) would approve futures-based exchange-traded funds (ETFs). But instead of it being a collective effort by both retail and institutional investors across multiple platforms, crypto exchange data shows that a large investor or investors on one particular exchange, using mostly a particular dollar-pegged stablecoin, are once again the main factor behind a rally.

An Oct. 18 newsletter by data firm Kaiko indicates that bitcoinâ€™s recent gains took off after the BTC/USDT spot trading pairâ€™s volume spiked around Oct. 10 on Binance, one of the worldâ€™s largest exchanges. The spike took place just a few days after one buyer or a group of buyers entered an order on Binance [on Oct. 6](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/10/06/bitcoin-price-rally-fueled-by-whales-16b-buy-blockchain-data-shows/) to buy $1.6 billion worth of bitcoin, which sent bitcoinâ€™s price skyrocketing 5% to about $55,500 at the time.

title: Key elements of a blockchain
body:
#### Distributed ledger technology

All network participants have access to the distributed ledger and its immutable record of transactions. With this shared ledger, transactions are recorded only once, eliminating the duplication of effort thatâ€™s typical of traditional business networks.

#### Immutable records

No participant can change or tamper with a transaction after itâ€™s been recorded to the shared ledger. If a transaction recordÂ includesÂ an error, a new transaction must be added to reverse the error, and both transactions are then visible.

#### Smart contracts

To speed transactions, a set of rules â€” called a smart contractâ€” is stored on the blockchain and executed automatically. A smart contract can define conditions for corporate bond transfers, include terms for travel insurance to be paid and much more.

title: Cases of temples
body:
With such a background, the wind of Taoist metaphysics talking is beyond imagination.These Taoist metaphysical talks are also called "micro talk", "clear talk", "clear discussion" and "clear debate".It became a fashionable topic to discuss Lao, Zhuang and Yi, which were called the "three mysteries of Taoism".Famous scholars who are proficient in the three mysteries are not only quick and eloquent in pure talk, but also have written books and academic achievements.The world called: metaphysician.

However, although the title of "metaphysician" was respected at the time, the title was not easy to come by.This metaphysical talk about Taoism often goes on all night, which is called "micro talk."Some scholars indulge in debate, has reached the point of forgetting to eat and sleep, there is a so-called "around eating, cold and warm number four";What is more, there are a few famous people.In order to cope with the victory in talk, unexpectedly to think all night long and tired sick or even tired to death.

Mr. Ji, the teacher, is also a celebrity among the local scholars.In this national daoism tide, nature is not immune from vulgarity.Whenever the fun comes, the old gentleman will talk about metaphysics after teaching.

However, with his knowledge and interest at that time, HE could not understand what the enthusiastic teacher was saying. He just stared blankly at the old gentleman's mouth, which seemed to never stop opening and closing. All he could do in his head was pray that the old school lesson would be over soon:

Anxious also can catch up with the rice fragrant floor of the day, worried to go late to be the fat account room scold, fear so will be the iron cock Liu shopkeeper to seize the opportunity to buckle wages......

His mind was full of other thoughts, just like the white dog, but none of them had anything to do with the subject of the lecture.

As a result, Mr. Ji was on the stage with a charm of tongue and a mysterious mystery, while his disciple Zhang Xingyan was sitting upright and preoccupied below.

But there were one or two stories in Mr Ji's talk that were not so dry, and they were inadvertently picked up by Xingyan.One time, the old gentleman mentioned that Kuangjia, the son of wei in the east of The city of Rao Zhou, was weak and good at talking about the mystery. Once, he fought with Xie Kun, a famous scholar of Wei River.

Looking at the teacher's sad appearance of "the wind is rueful, I see the water is cold", xiao Xingyan became extremely wary of the good fate of Lao Dao Qinghe, and decided that although he would continue to fight for the good fate of Lao Dao Qinghe, he should pay attention to the future, not to chat and fight with Lao Dao all night!

A little boy of about ten, his eyes closed, his tiny body unconsciously floating in a rectangular glass tank filled with turquoise liquid, his head shaved, a blood-red gash running from the middle of his bald head to the back of it, tightly sewn together.

The boy had a respirator in his mouth and a thin sheet of metal taped to his body, which was then led by tiny wires to a medical device outside the incubator.

Surrounded by state-of-the-art medical equipment, eeg and ecg showed that the boy was alive and well.

A group of men in white coats watched the boy from their jobs, crunching all sorts of data, through special bullet-proof glass five centimeters thick.

Miaohua Palace many female Taoist, shangqing Palace chong "Shangqing" "Jade Emperor" two classics;Tianshi Sect, also known as "Tianshi Dao" or "Wudoumi Sect", is said to have been founded by Zhang Daoling. It has the largest number of followers and the greatest momentum among the three Avenues Sect.

Different from miaohua Palace, which followed the women's line, and Tianshi School, which followed the mass line, The Upper Qing Palace, where the Qinghe river is located, was one of the three sects, which was relatively high and noble, mainly practicing Taoist classics such as the Jade Emperor's Sutra and the Upper Qing Sutra.Its Christian name, Shangqing, comes from the worship of Taoist three Qing patriarchs.

I do not know whether it is intentional or inadvertently, the qing Palace's name was to win the favor of the scholar-officials, the royal allotment of thousands of hectares of fertile land, where the Luofu Mountain, a circle of five hundred miles of the mountain field, has also been officially designated as the Private property of the Qing Palace.On the contrary, tian Shi Zong, who was more famous among the poor people, was not liked by Shi Lin.

In fact, it is necessary to trace the source carefully. Speaking of that, the Upper Qing Palace and the Heavenly Master school are quite related.It is said that the two religions were originally a family, but a certain generation due to the understanding of the doctrine of disagreement, there was a dispute in the door, so the descendants of Zhang Daoling, the fourth generation of heaven teacher Zhang Qing, will move the clan door to Heming Mountain, known as the "Heaven teacher".And those who stayed behind the religious elders, then founded the Upper Qing Palace, from their own school.

For most of the poor people, the Upper Qing Palace at that time undoubtedly symbolized the paradise of abundant food and clothing.If anyone can get involved with the Palace of the Qing dynasty, that is the world without worry.To be free from hunger all one's life was a great thing in the minds of most of the poor people at that time -- something that could only be dreamed of in a dream, perhaps!

When I woke up as an ignorant child, I realized that life was hard;Sensible, but also to food road.It was natural for xiao Xingyan, who had to run about for food and clothing, to focus his eyes on the "good karma of Rao State in the Palace of the Upper Qing Dynasty".

title: Artizen DAO
body:
[Artizen](https://www.artizen.fund/) is the largest platform for artist grants, and has pioneered a new model for community funded and curated grants. Our mission is to transform the way culture and public goods are funded, beginning with the arts. We are moving to web3 and invite you to join us as we build [Artizen DAO](https://artizen.link/pitch-deck).

Artizen helps communities come together and support the things they care about. We make it easy to create grants, raise money, curate awards, and reward donors with NFTsâ€Šâ€”â€Ša positive-feedback cycle that powers sustained support for your field, community, or cause.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wh78apEs5zDx5xZeMcWIm.jpg?height=1185&width=1920&&&&&&&size=medium)

## The Problem

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Baiou8j2Qv7gJFLh5Ka9C.png?height=838&width=2374&)

Grants are the lifeblood of the arts, but a new model for grants is deeply needed. The current system is centered around institutions, not communities, and as a result is bureaucratic, inefficient, and does not align incentives between donors, grantmakers, artists and fans:

* **Donors**: few rewards, no voice in curation, no relationship with artists and little stake in their success.
* **Grantmakers**: complex administration, overhead, challenges attracting and keeping donors.
* **Artists**: insufficient funding sources, onerous application processes, weak ties to donors. Few grants go directly to artists, most go to nonprofit gatekeepers who can afford full-time grant writers.
* **Fans**: not involved in the grant process at all, no incentive to become donors to a grant.

## The Solution

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fJonlq5vZGNGax7qPdwWp.png?height=802&width=2380)

Artizen has developed a new model for grants that aligns the incentives of grantmakers, donors, fans, and the artists they support. By combining crowdfunding, community curation, and NFT rewards, we can unlock new money, untapped network effects, and sustainable support for the artists in your community and every community around the world.

* By giving donors a voice in where their money goes, we give fans a reason to become donors;
* By eliminating bureaucracy, we give more money directly to artists, and simplify processes for both artists and grantmakers;
* And by rewarding donors with NFTs, we give everyone a stake in the projectâ€™s success, attracting more donors and creating stronger ties between supporters and artists.

## Artizen Grants Unite People

![The Dance by Matisse](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S590-O_XWeO8WoW5-oULX.jpeg?height=997&width=1500)

Since launching our MVP in 2021, Artizen has awarded nearly $500K to artists across more than 100 grants, grown to 12K+ members, and partnered with major companies and cultural institutions including Microsoft, HP, Unity Technologies, and the Cannes and Tribeca Film Festivals. These partners are excited to underwrite community grants because we give them a way to directly support causes they care about, while removing the complexities of running a grant themselves.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8fyRkr5vVNpe3BixCRYi.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

If youâ€™re HP, or Academy Award Winner Viola Davis, and you want to encourage more Black visionaries to explore new technology, you can either create and run your own complicated incubator, mentorship or prize program â€“ or you can simply back an Artizen grant.

## Artizen Curation Engine

Group decision-making is a challenge.  How do you give a voice to donors without making it just another popularity contest?  How can you give unknown artists an extra leg up?  How can a grantmaker guarantee high standards for winning artists, and keep a grant aligned with its original mission?  How do you create a positive, wagmi culture and avoid a dynamic of â€˜winnersâ€™ vs. â€˜losersâ€™?   How do you balance the power of small donors against big donors?

We have been iterating on these difficult questions over 100 grant cycles.  The result is our Curation Engine, a selection system that balances and harmonizes these interests.  Grantmakers choose juries who select finalists, who can guarantee high standards and continuity of mission.  [Quadratic voting](https://vitalik.ca/general/2019/12/07/quadratic.html) balances small and large donor power while still incentivizing donation.  And everybody wins: splitting prizes proportionally to upvotes avoids the disappointment and bad blood of winner-take-all contests.

Hereâ€™s how a grant works in practice:

* Artists submit project proposals.
* Jury, selected by the grantmaker, chooses 3-10 finalists.
* Community donates to buy upvotes.
* Community votes for their favorite of the Finalists.
* Project with the most votes is the winner, but all Finalists receive the donations behind the votes they got.
* Winner creates an Artifact (more about this later).

![Artizen Curation Engine](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZMRZDCSXjwYcQdEaX8zPa.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

## Community Curation Drives Growth

Weâ€™ve discovered something remarkable: community curation drives growth.  By giving donors a voice in selecting winners, artists have a reason to invite fans, and fans have a reason to become donors. The most successful Artizen grants grow rapidly because of this dynamic, and we are modeling the web3 version of Artizen on their success.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FBwktpfurvbhcvq1zfSVV.png?height=908&width=2360)

## NFT Rewards

We are building a new version of our platform on web3 for two reasons.  The first is to use NFT rewards to â€˜close the loop,â€™ connecting the value of the art to the donors who support it.

For each grant cycle, donors will receive an NFT representing their support (a portion of an Artifact, described below).  Designed with the winning artist, it will combine the ideas of a [POAP](https://poap.xyz/) with NFT art â€“ both a badge of support and a tangible asset that can appreciate in step with the growth of the artistâ€™s career.  In addition, royalties from any trading of these tokens goes back into the Matching Fund to â€˜pay forwardâ€™ into future grants.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/H0CJWMuc8iMDHrGYku6rT.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

NFTs will also connect the success of individual grants to the health of the whole grant ecosystem through the ARTIZEN ARTIFACTS.

## Artifacts Power the Artizen DAO

The second reason we are moving to web3 is because we want Artizen to be owned by its community.

Artizen Artifacts are NFTs that represent collective ownership of the platform, which will transition to a DAO structure.  Artifact holders will be investors, arts leaders, grantmakers and grantwinners, and anyone else invested in building a brighter future for art, science, and culture.

![Vincent van Gogh's Ear](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s4yb1XaI_f4cwNWANhrPr.gif?height=338&width=600)

Royalties from Artifact sales go back into the Matching Fund, which will provide ongoing support for all grants.  Each grant cycle mints 3 new Artifacts, designed by the winning artist â€“ one for the DAO, one for the artist, and one fractionalized as rewards to their donors.

As the company transitions to distributed governance, the community can experiment with new structures and policies.

The collection begins with 1,111 objects from the history of art around the world, designed by Nak Yong Choi with sound by Elliot Cole.  These 3D objects will be interoperable with Jadu, Sandbox, and elsewhere in the metaverse.

And finally, this collection (and community) will grow as new grantwinning work is also memorialized in Artifacts.

A man with a big nose, black beard and a resemblance to Super Mario Appears in his view. He quickly pulls white gloves out of a colored leather bag he is carrying and starts examining Dawn.

The dead!

Damn it! Looks like he landed on the back of his head!

"Hey, Tony, Tony?Can you hear me?"He waved his hand in front of Dawn's eyes, his voice clearly more anxious than before.

Dawn's eyes moved at last. He focused on the man's face, strange but familiar...

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8fyRkr5vVNpe3BixCRYi.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

If youâ€™re HP, or Academy Award Winner Viola Davis, and you want to encourage more Black visionaries to explore new technology, you can either create and run your own complicated grant, incubator, or mentorship program â€“ or you can simply back an Artizen grant.

## Artizen Curation Engine

Group decision-making is a challenge.  How do you give a voice to donors without making it just another popularity contest?  How can you give unknown artists an extra leg up?  How can a grantmaker guarantee high standards for winning artists, and keep a grant aligned with its original mission?  How do you create a positive, wagmi culture and avoid a dynamic of â€˜winnersâ€™ vs. â€˜losersâ€™?   How do you balance the power of small donors against big donors?

We have been iterating on these difficult questions over 100 grant cycles.  The result is our Curation Engine, a selection system that balances and harmonizes these interests.  Grantmakers choose juries who select finalists, who can guarantee high standards and continuity of mission.  [Quadratic voting](https://vitalik.ca/general/2019/12/07/quadratic.html) balances small and large donor power while still incentivizing donation.  And everybody wins: splitting prizes proportionally to upvotes avoids the disappointment and bad blood of winner-take-all contests.

Hereâ€™s how a grant works in practice:

* Artists submit project proposals.
* Jury, selected by the grantmaker, chooses 3-10 finalists.
* Community donates to buy upvotes.
* Community votes for their favorite of the Finalists.
* Project with the most votes is the winner, but all Finalists receive the donations behind the votes they got.
* Winner creates an Artifact (more about this later).

![Artizen Curation Engine](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZMRZDCSXjwYcQdEaX8zPa.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

## Community Curation Drives Growth

Weâ€™ve discovered something remarkable: community curation drives growth.  By giving donors a voice in selecting winners, artists have a reason to invite fans, and fans have a reason to become donors. The most successful Artizen grants grow rapidly because of this dynamic, and we are modeling the web3 version of Artizen on their success.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/idR26Y7n3QnguyQC8XbUX.jpg?height=908&width=2500)

## NFT Rewards

We are building a new version of our platform on web3 for two reasons.  The first is to use NFT rewards to â€˜close the loop,â€™ connecting the value of the art to the donors who support it.

For each grant cycle, donors will receive an NFT representing their support (a portion of an Artifact, described below).  Designed with the winning artist, it will combine the ideas of a [POAP](https://poap.xyz/) with NFT art â€“ both a badge of support and a tangible asset that can appreciate in step with the growth of the artistâ€™s career.  In addition, royalties from any trading of these tokens goes back into the Matching Fund to â€˜pay forwardâ€™ into future grants.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/H0CJWMuc8iMDHrGYku6rT.jpg?height=1260&width=2410)

NFTs will also connect the success of individual grants to the health of the whole grant ecosystem through the ARTIZEN ARTIFACTS.

## Artifacts Power the Artizen DAO

The second reason we are moving to web3 is because we want Artizen to be owned by its community.

Artizen Artifacts are NFTs that represent collective ownership of the platform, which will transition to a DAO structure.  Artifact holders will be investors, arts leaders, grantmakers and grantwinners, and anyone else invested in building a brighter future for art, science, and culture.

![Vincent van Gogh's Ear](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s4yb1XaI_f4cwNWANhrPr.gif?height=338&width=600)

Royalties from Artifact sales go back into the Matching Fund, which will provide ongoing support for all grants.  Each grant cycle mints 3 new Artifacts, designed by the winning artist â€“ one for the DAO, one for the artist, and one fractionalized as rewards to their donors.

As the company transitions to distributed governance, the community can experiment with new structures and policies.

The collection begins with 1,111 objects from the history of art around the world, designed by Nak Yong Choi with sound by Elliot Cole.  These 3D objects will be interoperable with Jadu, Sandbox, and elsewhere in the metaverse.

And finally, this collection (and community) will grow as new grantwinning work is also memorialized in Artifacts.
