title: NFT Future Friday - 22 October
body:
Welcome to the first edition of NFT Future Friday, where weâ€™ll take a look at some awesome projects with upcoming releases in the near future, including all the links necessary to learn everything you need to know before making a decision to mint or purchase. Today Iâ€™ll start by diving deeper into three primary projects, while listing some honorable mentions that you can do your own research on after reading.

**Please note:** I spent quite some time going through upcoming projects that mint in the next week (since I was hoping to find these for the "Future Fridays" post), but I was unable to find projects that I was particularly interested in. It seems that this upcoming week might be a bit slow in NFT-land as there's lots of shit but few quality projects releasing this week, so I'm going to cover some recent/upcoming projects that might be a bit more on the expensive side. I just hope this will serve as a showcase of what "good" NFT projects look like, both in terms of art quality and community!

Let's dive in.


---

# Project #1: Habibi

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MarkTheHabibi) | [Opensea](https://opensea.io/collection/generation-habibi-mint-pass) | [Discord](discord.gg/habibis)

![Habibi Preview](http://habibi.family/images/205.webp)

Habibi is a very interesting project that came across my desk a few weeks ago while lounging about the Stellar channel in the Missing Frontier Discord server. Many of the NFT pros had been mentioning this great artist "Mark the Habibi" and repping his work, so I took a look at his Opensea profile and was amazed by what I saw:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d6haq22PqwfCYzSKAxnNd.png?height=846&width=1549)

Few profile picture projects (PFPs) are as unique, colorful, and distinctive as Habibi's collection. What you see above are animated 1/1's previously released, although today (technically yesterday since this newsletter is late) was the first day where his art was released to the public. Last night, 1000 mint passes for his first collection of 1000 Habibi's was released in a Dutch auction (starting at 2 ETH and slowly lowering the price until it is sold out) where over 600/1000 were bought at a price of 0.5 ETH within about 90 seconds. Those lucky enough to obtain a mint pass will have their Habibi's revealed next week on 27 October. However, if you're looking to get a Habibi you don't need to wait until next week, you can head to his Opensea profile and purchase a [public mint pass](https://opensea.io/assets/0x6d7c78944158925d7bf41ac228c0cbbca1133d83/2) (approximately 0.6 ETH at the time of this posting).

![The public mint pass linked above](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/gQWHK_xv_bYBGwFzSsl6p.png?height=336&width=456)


---

# Project #2: Arcus by Rik Oostenbroek

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/RikOostenbroek) | [Opensea](https://opensea.io/collection/arcus-rik) | [SuperRare](https://superrare.com/rikoostenbroek) | [Website](https://rikoostenbroek.com/arcus-collection) | [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/USGzm8V9)

![Image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FCXibyTX0AgdW4r?format=jpg&name=small)

Showing some love to our fellow Dutch artists, Rik Oostenbroek is a visual artist from Hilversum with over a decade of experience working with enormous brands such as Apple, Mercedes, Red Bull, and more. Arcus represents the first major series this artist has released as NFTs, although he has been working on this series for over 5 years.

Motion and color collide in fluid, dynamic infinite topologies that one might expect to see in an advanced geometry textbook, where smooth shapes flow like storm clouds into and over itself in a stunning display of static motion. These pieces of art represent phases of the artist's journey throughout his career, and his website contains detailed descriptions describing the state of mind he was in when these pieces were originally conceived.

Make note: these are absolutely collector's items, and are not meant for a quick flip. Starting the sales at 1.5 ETH, these may have a higher barrier to entry than most, but considering that his direct sales have resulted in a floor of over 16 ETH on OpenSea, those looking for long-term investment in AAA-quality digital art need look no further than Nederland's own Rik Oostenbroek.

This series is being released slowly as direct raffles available to customers who sign up on his website. For more information on how to acquire an Arcus, visit his website listed above or hop into his Discord to ask more questions. In order to obtain one of these unique NFTs, you're going to need to be patient and stay on top of his Twitter feed in order to sign up for the next drop.


---

# Project 3: NeoNexus on Solana

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/neonexus_world) | [Golden Tickets](https://magiceden.io/marketplace/neonexus_golden_tickets_first_5000) | [Residential Properties](https://magiceden.io/marketplace/neonexus_residential) | [Website](https://www.neonexus.io) | [Discord](https://discord.gg/6ZAwswhBWe)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Y-EkT6i9_ZV0o8XSIL6u0.png?height=301&width=900)

In order to counter-balance the first two projects, which are admittedly on the more expensive side (though for obvious reasons) I am going to cover an upcoming project on Solana that has a very low barrier to entry, NeoNexus.

NeoNexus is a recently released NFT "social game" project on the Solana blockchain that is building a "neon cyberpunk" dystopian universe where gangs roam the streets and warlords do back-room dealings with corrupt politicians and corporate overlords, extracting wealth and developing the "Mind Augmentation Device," a metaverse-inspired technology that the citizens have been using as entertainment and distraction while the real masters continue about their nefarious business. The team is highly active in their already-active Discord server, where the community is busy role-playing and crafting their own unique characters inside the NeoNexus universe.

**So what gives? Why is this a good investment?**

Purchasing a golden ticket (particularly those numbered #1-5000, see link above) grants you lifetime access to upcoming NFT mints, free airdrops (I've already received 2 free airdrops), access to REAL-LIFE events that the community puts together, and much more. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nj_6NnPeFH7FpNKwoM0Ug.png?height=403&width=923)

November has a lot of upcoming events for NeoNexus, so securing a Golden Ticket allows you to get first in line (and guaranteed mints) of upcoming properties, characters, and items in the NeoNexus universe. NeoNexus is currently one of the most popular non-profile picture Solana NFT projects, and is poised to become a "blue chip" NFT project on the Solana platform.

Don't forget, even if you decide to sell your minted NFTs you can still hang on to your golden ticket and either sell it for another person to enter the ecosystem, or you can hang on to it just in case you want to re-enter and participate in future drops and releases.


---

# Honorable Mentions:

* [Doodles](https://opensea.io/collection/doodles-official) ([Website](https://doodles.app/)) are a very unique (yet strikingly familiar) NFT profile picture project from well-known artist Burnt Toast. Recently he dropped his Doodles PFP project (10,000 items) that are pastel-colored and incredibly unique when compared to other PFP projects. These definitely have a long-term future due to their uniqueness and cuteness factor alone, and the floor is currently at about 1.35 ETH.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UFt7hOzjZNID5cHIWV7Pd.png?height=304&width=1561)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z2QuvvbBRMBwcJkpgzW0s.png?height=298&width=1544)

* [Alpacadabras](https://alpacadabraz.io/) ([Website](https://alpacadabraz.io/)) are a brand new project that is about to finish minting (sorry, white list only, I am not on the white list either) that have a relatively low floor of about 0.25 ETH. A collection of 9669 Alpacas with super-alpaca abilities, this pixelated art project has a full rarity table and a [discord server](https://discord.gg/qz8r5qUSXc) of over 50k members, so if you're looking for an active community with a cheap floor for entry, this might be your best bet in the short term!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wrwxQrG6kVL0ddlNapYCj.png?height=689&width=1580)

* [BearX](https://discord.gg/bear-x) is an upcoming pixelated bear PFP project. I cannot recommend anything more than attempting to get on the whitelist for the upcoming launch. There is not a website (yet) and the art can be found on the Discord server linked above. Some examples of the art can be seen below:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/khe0gNyu97BYmB4VcrFUM.png?height=489&width=495)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hfP0VcdAOd2805EZqCroF.png?height=463&width=492)

Since this project is so early, itâ€™s difficult to determine if this is a long-term worthy project. But if you can get on the white list, you can probably do a quick flip because the Discord is so large. Good luck!


---

My apologies for the late post, but hopefully this was a decent insight into the few quality projects that released recently, as well as a few suggestions for current/upcoming projects that might be worth investigating! If you have any questions, you can always shoot me a message on [Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/plAIgrounds) or Discord (Zomboy#2590).

See you next time!

title: The Journey to Ekur - Chapter 1
body:
![Noah](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AsDYNwHe2nCNdGwZuFoSP.png?height=1684&width=1103)

Noah glanced around the party, sipping his drink. His familyâ€™s common room was crowded with people, the mirrored walls creating the illusion that Noah was infinitely more popular than he actually was. Servo-bots hummed here and there, delivering drinks and snacks, their dull colors contrasting with the bright clothes of the partygoers. A few of the guys were debating something over by the food table, and Andi was loudly insisting that karaoke would absolutely be a great idea if people would just give it a chance. Every few minutes, Noah glanced down at his arm. The readout said, â€œCELEBRATE,â€ the AIâ€™s only advice on how to make the most of his birthday.Â 

Or, almost his birthday. He wouldnâ€™t be eighteen â€” and he wouldnâ€™t know his life path â€” until midnight.Â 

He glanced down at his implant again, then back around the gathering. He was having a good time. At least, he was pretty sure he was having a good time, but the thought of what the readout would say come midnight kept pulling him away from the fun. Would it be what he hoped?

He shook his head, taking another sip. Of course, it would be. His father was one of the most well-respected scholars in the city. Noahâ€™s own intellect had helped him skate through much of the earlier stages of a study that his friends had to work non-stop to even make it through. He was clearly cut out for the upper echelons. He might even be placed right away in his fatherâ€™s level, though likely in a smaller role.Â 

â€œNoah! Come on!â€ Andi stood over him, tugging his arm. â€œI set up a duet! Come sing with me!â€Â 

â€œWhy donâ€™t you sit?â€ Noah invited Andi, scooting to the side on the long, low couch. â€œHave some water, take a break?â€

She sighed, collapsing next to him. â€œEveryone acts like fun games are below us. Just because weâ€™re nerds doesnâ€™t mean we canâ€™t have fun,â€ she complained, blowing a raspberry at the ceiling. Noah smiled. Andi had been the life of the party going on ten years now â€“ always pulling him and their other friends out of their shells, the one who convinced them to try something new, something different. If she hadnâ€™t been there to stir things up, and well enough had been left alone, Noah was sure he and the rest of the guys would have spent their lives buried in books and caught up in the meaningless debate. Though she had been spending more time with him than the others in their group â€“ no. Noah cautioned himself. She was paying him special attention for his birthday. That was all. No need to read into it any more than that.

Noah motioned to a nearby serving unit to bring them some refreshments. â€œHow are you liking your new path?â€ he asked, attempting to change the subject. Â 

Andiâ€™s face lit up. â€œItâ€™s incredible,â€ she crowed. â€œI mean, I wasnâ€™t sure about it at first. QA testing? I thought it would be a total bore, but you know how it is.â€ She reached out for a bottle of water as the small robot returned, taking a deep drink before she spoke again. â€œThatâ€™s better. You still have to sing with me after this, by the way. You arenâ€™t getting out of it.â€Â 

â€œItâ€™s my birthday, Iâ€™m pretty sure Iâ€™m in charge of deciding what I get out of,â€ he replied. â€œBut why did you go along with testing? Even if you didnâ€™t want to do it?â€

She gave him a brief stare, looking confused. â€œWhat do you mean?â€

â€œI mean, you didnâ€™t want to do it, right?â€

â€œI didnâ€™t think I would like it, but thatâ€™s not the same as not wanting to do it. The path analysis algorithm is like â€” I donâ€™t know. It knows, right? And it was right. I love finding the issues that the developers didnâ€™t expect. Thinking of the ways people are going to use things that they didnâ€™t account for. Itâ€™s like a puzzle, every time, and I love those. I just didnâ€™t know the job would be like that.â€Â 

â€œThatâ€™s fair, I guess,â€ Noah said, setting down his drink. He didnâ€™t want to talk about this anymore. Any time he tried to bring up his worries about the whole process, people just kept giving him that same look, like he was speaking gibberish. It was just dumb insecurities, he reassured himself, as he stood and made his way over to the karaoke station, hearing Andiâ€™s shouts of joy followed by groans from the others. Throughout the song, and for the rest of the evening, he couldnâ€™t stop worrying. What if the AI didnâ€™t give him what he wanted?Â 

â€œThanks for singing with me tonight,â€ Andi said. â€œYou basically gave me a gift on your birthday.â€ She hugged him before heading out the door, hopping on one of the transpods with some of the other guys. He waved them away, their faces vanishing quickly as the bullet-shaped pod was whisked away down the suspended tube system that ran throughout the entire city. *Faster than a car, and more efficient*, his father always said, every time Noah mentioned that it might actually be nice to have something a little more fun to get around on. *We focus on what works, not whatâ€™s superfluous.* Well, he thought sourly, Andi seemed to focus on the superfluous plenty, and she was basically the only interesting thing about life at the moment.Â 

His friends had all offered to stay and be there with him when his path was revealed, but Noah felt like he had to do this alone. If it wasnâ€™t what he wanted â€” well, he wouldnâ€™t be able to stand their platitudes and assurances that it would actually work out for the best. He was smart. He deserved a top job. Anything less would be a waste. He was sure of it.

So why was he still worried?Â 

He hung around, feeling awkward as the servo-bots cleaned the space. They hadnâ€™t gone too hard â€” that kind of excess wasnâ€™t something people with their kind of training could really let themselves loose to do â€” but it was still a mess. He thought about helping, but the bots were programmed to get offended whenever you tried to step in. Some quirk his father had programmed in.Â 

â€œTheyâ€™re here to help! We need to learn to accept the help technology gives us. Without it, we would have never have gotten to where we are today.â€ Â  His fatherâ€™s voice rattled around his head.

Noah watched the clock. Nearly there. He looked down at his arm again. It had registered that the guests had left and the servo-bots had been engaged, and it was now recommending that he get a good nightâ€™s sleep.Â 

As if he could sleep in this mindset.Â 

At the thought, another message scrolled through, recommending relaxing activities â€” a long bath or some downers to help him fall asleep. He shook his head. He needed to know. One minute. He closed his eyes, holding his breath. He could see it now. The display would change, thereâ€™d be so much information heâ€™d have to project it, or sit there and watch the words scroll by an inch a minute on the small integrated screen. Three years as a secondary academic, the standard. Even with his skills, he couldnâ€™t get away from that. And then the big leagues. In charge of his own research projects. Heâ€™d have scores of younger academics working under him, helping him make his discoveries. Theyâ€™d advance everything. Noah would surpass his father, just like he had always hoped.Â 

A small ding. An update. His eyes snapped open and looked down. Words whirred past and he tapped the controls to expand the screen out until it materialized above his arm.Â 

LIFE PATH OUTPUT

5 YEARS â€“ SCRIBE IN SERVICE

ADVANCEMENT IS DEPENDENT ON WORK COMPLETED

POTENTIAL MARRIAGE PROJECTED â€“ YEAR 2 OF WORK

DETERMINATION â€“ QUALIFIED TO BECOME PARENT

ARRANGE MATTERS AND REPORT AT THE NEAREST SCRIBE FACILITY TO BEGIN WORK.

Noah couldnâ€™t stop staring at the words. Scribe? Students were scribes. Low-scorers were scribes. People who hadnâ€™t succeeded in exams, who had to prove they could even be functional in the highest academic ranks. He had always been one of the highest achievers among his class. This simply didnâ€™t make sense. There had to be some sort of malfunction.Â 

Noah hit the explanatory readout, switched on the voiceover. He couldnâ€™tâ€™ stand to read anymore.Â 

â€œScribe role assigned based on previous work ethic,â€ the pleasant voice readout.Â 

â€œWhy?â€ he demanded. â€œMy scores are way too high to be a scribe!â€Â 

After a brief pause, it continued, â€œNatural skill is present, and accolades are offered. However, high scholar positions demand the ability to do extensive amounts of research. Personality review and historical analysis determine that research is not a strong suit nor strong interest. If a higher position is desired, need to improve and excel in all areas of research. Even those historically considered.â€ With that, the thing whirred and clicked before playing back a recording of his own voice, saying, â€œstupidly boring.â€Â 

He cringed at the sound of his words. â€œI was just saying that. I do the research when it needs doing.â€

The AI beeped, sounding almost annoyed. â€œResearch done has not been up to par. Critiques against your work have historically centered around source use and verification.â€

â€œBut I got good results!â€ His voice was high, desperate.Â 

â€œCorrect results often, but through the wrong parameters. Too likely to introduce error into future projects. Scribe work will ensure that skills are honed to correct degree before continued advancement.â€

â€œFive years?â€ Noah moaned, slumping down in a chair. The AI chirped again, about to respond, but he flicked the voice off. It could run text lines along his arm all it wanted. It wouldnâ€™t change anything. It wouldnâ€™t change that it was wrong. So, what if researching wasnâ€™t his favorite? He was good at running team projects, and heâ€™d have plenty people working underneath him as a rising scholar. These demands about legwork were absurd.Â 

Noah jumped up. Surely, his father would be able to do something about this. If anything, it would be a shame to him to have his son in such a lowly position. The AI was supposed to take family dynamics into account. One talk with his father should straighten things out, snap this stupid thing back on his arm to reality. If his father objected to his position, the AI would have to reconsider.Â 

Anxious excitement welled in him as he took the lift to his fatherâ€™s study. The old man had made a brief appearance at his party, greeting guests, but the real family celebrations were always saved for the day of. Noah knocked on the door to his fatherâ€™s study and stepped through before waiting for a response. His father looked up from his readout on his desk.Â 

â€œThe birthday boy!â€ he said, standing with a smile, then glancing down at his arm. â€œPast midnight â€” itâ€™s official! Whatâ€™s the news?â€

Noah thrust out his arm so the readout faced his father, tapping to pull up the holo-display. â€œScribe,â€ he said. â€œA low-level scribe. For five years! Can you believe it?â€

His fatherâ€™s face stiffened for a second, then he nodded. â€œWell, Iâ€™m sure you will do the work justice. Easily be the best among their ranks.â€

â€œWhat are you talking about?â€ Noah exclaimed. â€œYou canâ€™t be happy with this. Me, your son? The son of a great scholar, basically consigned to copying other peopleâ€™s work like a child learning his letters? This is a shame to our family. A shame to the work Iâ€™ve done!â€Â 

â€œThis is no shame,â€ his father snapped. â€œDoing the work helps us all, no matter what level you are at. Without the scribes, it cannot be done at all. And you would look down on them? Great scholars know that no achievement is made alone, no work is done by one. And you want to be, what? Raised up because you scored high on exams?â€ He shook his head. â€œYou are acting shamefully here. Nothing bad is being done to you.â€

â€œYou just donâ€™t want to admit the precious pathing algorithm youâ€™ve spent half your life on can make a mistake,â€ Noah spat. â€œThis is all for your ego. Youâ€™re just as disappointed as me, but it would be worse if you admitted your work failed. Thatâ€™s it, right? Youâ€™re protecting your ego here?â€Â 

Noahâ€™s father turned his back and made his way to his seat without meeting Noahâ€™s gaze.Â 

â€œAnd what would you do?â€

â€œWhat do you mean?â€ Noah asked.Â 

â€œWhat will you do? Besides being a scribe? Your life path is right there. You think my office would take you without a life path recommendation?â€Â 

â€œIâ€™llâ€”â€ Noah stopped. What would he do? Itâ€™s not like there were many options. He might be able to find something equivalent to scribe, maybe a reviewer for lower-level publications, thereâ€™s a chance they would take him â€” but why would they? His pre-determined path was there. Noah shook his head. â€œI'll figure something out!â€ he said, heading towards the door. â€œAnd when I do, Iâ€™ll show you that this is wrong. This is not what is meant for me.â€ Â 

His father did not respond, and Noah fumed as he took the lift to his room, hastily stuffing a bag with clothes and some credits before heading down to the street.Â 

He hopped onto a transpod heading towards the center of the city. There had to be more options. He couldnâ€™t be the first one to have ended up with such a wildly wrong life path. There had to be something more.Â

title: Gunbot StepGrid Strategy Settings Ultimate Guide - CryptoDROI
body:
## Find out How to Set-up the Gunbot StepGrid Strategy in this Step by Step Simple Guide

The new [Gunbot V.23](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-v23-released-ultimate-strategy-setup-guide/) Stable version is out, and a new strategy for you to earn more. Take advantage of this new price action trading method included in all [Standard](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-standard/), [Pro](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-pro/), or [Ultimate Gunbot](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-ultimate/) Editions.

Suppose you want to make money in crypto trading in the long run. In that case, your trading strategy must give you an edge because without an advantage, even if you have the best risk management, discipline, and psychology, youâ€™ll still be a losing trader.

> And this edge is what the Gunbot StepGrid strategy gives you!

Guntharâ€™s legendary â€œ**Gunbot the Way I Run it**â€ article that we havenâ€™t see since Gunbot V11 is out again. Gunthar got inspired one more time and took the time to explain how he runs Gunbot.

This time he and Pim tuned a unique strategy and named it â€œ**The Gunbot stepGrid Strategy**,â€ this strategy follows the main principles as the [SpotGrid strategy](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-v23-released-ultimate-strategy-setup-guide/#Gunbot_Spot_Grid_Strategy).

The *StepGrid strategy* capitalizes on the predictability of the crypto markets, following the price range only without any other trading indicator.

Before we begin, let me give you three remarkable facts about â€œ**Price Action**.â€

1. Price action trading is about understanding the imbalance between buying and selling pressure so you can identify trading opportunities and make a profit.
2. As a price action trader, price is king, and everything else is secondary.
3. Price action trading is not only a strategy but a structure for trading in different market conditions.

**The strategy logic is simple**: BUY when the coin price goes down by â€œxâ€ amount of price value (for example, $500) and SELL when the price goes up by the same â€œxâ€ value.

For example, the bot can buy $250 worth of bitcoin every time the price drops $500 in value and sell $250 worth of bitcoin every time the price rises $500 in value.

**Math calculation based on the above example**:

* $250 worth of bitcoin at a price of 34k is equal to 0.00735394BTC
* 0.00735394BTC sold at 34.5k is equal to $253.67
* Net Profit 1.46%

If you donâ€™t want to run out of money, you have to calculate your **TRADING_LIMIT** based on your wallet balance and consider the price of bitcoin as if it would have dumped a lot.

**Hereâ€™s how to calculate your TRADING_LIMIT based on your Total Balance**:

Divide the price by the step and then divide your Total Balance by the result, like this: Wallet Balance/(price/step)

**For example**: With a wallet balance of 10k USD and a bitcoin price at 35k, a â€œSTEPâ€ of 500 dollars would give you 142 dollars max of TRADING_LIMIT

The idea is to keep some balance to cover if Bitcoin drops by a lot, so, regardless of how much the bitcoin price goes down, you can keep running your bot without running out of money.

Keeping Gunbot running means you will be able to trade continuously, taking advantage of the perpetual swinging of the USDT/BTC pair.

### Gunbot StepGrid Strategy Keypoints

* Calculate your Trading Limit so you never run out of money, or your bot gets stuck because you got useless bags.
* Run this strategy only on coins you consider spendable â€œmoney.â€ In other words, donâ€™t go for â€œSuper-Shitcoinsâ€ ğŸ™‚
* If you run out of money because you didnâ€™t calculate your TRADING_LIMIT with the above formula, do not add more funds to your balance. If youâ€™re in a position, the bot will start selling at a loss because this strategy doesnâ€™t consider BREAK EVEN unless the price is above your BREAK EVEN price.

The automatic trailing from the SpotGrid strategy family is now available on the Gunbot StepGrid strategy, too, on both buy and sell orders. Pim developed a system that would adjust your STEP automatically as the pair swinging range contracts or expand.

The crypto trading bot strategy calculates the **STEP** value automatically, no need for any unique settings. It continuously watches that specific pair volatility and adjusts the STEP internally to fix the price action and trade.

If you want to run manual steps, set AUTO_STEP_SIZE: â€œfalseâ€ and enter a STEP_SIZE price value. However, trailing is hardcoded for buys and sells in the step grid. It starts trailing every time a step reaches the target.

With ENFORCE_STEP, instead, you can make it respect steps when trailing. It also supports Keep_Quote.

I did my best to explain his Guntharish, but if you want to read the original article, please check [Gunbot V23 the Way I run it](https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1715214.msg57407479#msg57407479) by Gunthar on BitcoinTalk.

## Gunbot Step-Grid Strategy

The Gunbot stepGrid strategy is an advanced price strategy that triggers a â€œBUYâ€ or â€œSELLâ€ signal when the price moves above or below your defined step.

You can choose between two-step size options â€” Auto and Manual, while the trailing price is fully automatic and takes place on every step, either up or down.

**Step-Grid** is a simple but effective trading strategy. The idea of this strategy is to trade small price movements.

Even if youâ€™re in an overall losing position, the strategy will still make you money by taking advantage of small price increases and sell portions at higher rates than their comparable buy orders.

Unlike most other Gunbot strategies, this strategy has only a few options and doesnâ€™t use confirmation indicators. The step grid method behaves this way because it only needs to confirm that the price has moved in a particular direction.

### StepGrid Trading Behavior with Auto Step Size

The â€œStep-Upâ€ and â€œStep-Downâ€ are placed close to the last order rate. But if the pair has never traded before, the reference price for the steps is the pairâ€™s price when you started running the strategy.

When the price moves down one step, it automatically starts buying, trailing, and places a buy order for 1x the â€œTrading Limitâ€ as soon as the trailing finishes.

When the price moves up one step while below break-even, it automatically starts selling, trailing, and places a sell order when the trailing finishes. Below break even, each sell order is 1x the â€œTrading Limitâ€ in size.

The behavior is the same when the price is above your break-even, but the order quantities can exceed 1x the â€œTrading Limit.â€ If the price reaches a complete step above break even, it will sell that bag right away.

When the price increases enough to reach the point where the next buy step is above break-even, the buy step acts as a stop in profit for positions bigger than 4x the â€œTrading Limit.â€

> Gunbot will buy again when it reaches the next purchase or sell step, and youâ€™re in no position.

The bot will continue to accumulate until it reaches the â€œMax Buy Countâ€ or when it runs out of available funds. Every new buy order will lower the break-even price.

Managing your balance is critical for your success with the Gunbot StepGrid strategy. Make sure you can afford the intended number of buy orders.

The following trading targets are constantly visible on your Gunbot GUI charts. Remember that the target lines keep moving all the time, and they represent the current targets.

## How to Create a Gunbot StepGrid Strategy

On your Gunbot GUI, click on the â€œStrategiesâ€ tab to create a new strategy, name it, and select stepGrid as your BUY and SELL methods, then click â€œCreate.â€

### Gunbot StepGrid Strategy Basic Settings

**Here are the three step-grid strategy basic settings**:

**Trading Limit**: This is the amount of Base currency you want to invest per buy order.

On the USDT-BTC pair, a trading limit of 100 means that you want to invest $100 every time it creates a new buy order. Always make sure youâ€™re trading limit value is higher than the Minimum Volume to Sell.

**Min Volume to Sell**: The value you add here will set the limit of your sell orders. You should set it to the minimum tradeable size according to your chosen exchange.

[Gunbot](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot/) wonâ€™t sell if your Quote coin value is lower than your defined amount. The bot will ignore small untradeable balances.

**Max Buy Count**: Limits how many buy orders are allowed. Setting a max buy count of 999 means that the bot will do 999 buy orders in a row. When you reach the specified maximum, the strategy will go into â€œSell Mode.â€

There are a few more settings that you can optionally use with this strategy, described below.

### Gunbot StepGrid Strategy Supplemental Settings

Here are a few extra settings you can implement with the step grid strategy.

**Auto Step Size**: When you switch it to Enabled, it will use automatic step size for your BUY and SELL orders.

Auto step size attempts to determine the steps that work. When youâ€™re not in a position, the auto step size is smaller than when youâ€™re in a [trading position](https://cryptodroi.com/position-size-analysis-crypto-trading-101/). When disabled, you can set a manual step size instead.

**Step Size**: This is the manual step size of your BUY and SELL orders.Sets a manual step size, and the value represents a price. Setting 100 on USDT-BTC makes the bot trade each time the price moves by 100 USDT.

**Enforce Step Size**: When you enable this setting, it will restrict BUY and SELL trailing to step size.

When enabled, the price trailing cannot trigger trades at rates lower than the current step size. This StepGrid setting ensures a minimum distance between orders.

**Stop After Next Sell**: To stop trading a pair after the position closes.

The bot will not place buy orders when there is no balance left to sell when this setting is enabled. Averaging down the current position continues, and partial sell orders do not make the bot stop afterward.

**Period**: This is the time frame you wish to trade; it sets the chart interval. The default period is 15. Make sure only to use supported period values.â€‹

**SMA Period**: You set how many candles you want to use to calculate the strategy support and resistance levels.

The default to calculate support and resistance is 50 candles. This strategy uses support and resistance to determine suitable trailing ranges.

**ATR Period**: How many candles Gunbot will use for calculating the [Average True Range](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-technical-indicators-explained/#Gunbot_Technical_Indicators_-_Average_True_Range_ATR) (ATR)

ATR is used to determine the auto step size; the default is setting is to use a 50-period ATR. Using lower values might cause the step size to swing too fast.

**Keep Quote**: This setting allows you to hold some of your earned crypto and not trade with it.â€‹When you set a â€œKeep Quoteâ€ value higher than 0, Gunbot will hold your set amount when the next sell order happens.

**Extra stepGrid Parameters**

You can set Buy and Sell â€œenableâ€ or â€œdisableâ€ in the pair override section, and if you enable â€œWatch Mode,â€ the bot wonâ€™t buy or sell.

You donâ€™t need any other settings for the StepGrid strategy. All the system requires to function correctly is written above. If there is any change, this article will reflect the newest info.

Again, feel free to check the [Gunbot wiki](https://wiki.gunthy.org/trading-strategy-options/regular-strategies-spot-trading/stepgrid) if you have any doubts.

## Autoconfig Controller for the stepGrid strategy

**FREE stepGrid Controller**: Autonomous Spot Trading Strategy by Boekenbox

Pim has uploaded a dynamic version of the Step-Grid strategy preconfigured using Autoconfig.

Your download will include many pre-made configurations for you to use in spot exchanges like Binance, Huobi, Kraken, Kucoin, and Gunthy Mex. All you have to do is add your [Gunthy wallet](https://cryptodroi.com/how-to-setup-your-gunthy-wallet-and-exchange/) in the config js file and choose how many pairs you want to trade.

Once you set it up, the [autoconfig controller](https://cryptodroi.com/autoconfig/) will start scanning for volatile pairs and adding them automatically. Then the bot will trade with them using the *native stepGrid strategy*.

The stepGrid controller monitors whatâ€™s happening in the crypto market. If, for example, a currency is doing poorly, it will replace it with a better-performing one so you can always make the most profitable trading with the best-performing pairs of your chosen exchange.

You can trade multiple base currencies with ease. The Step Grid control will automatically prevent the overlap between pairs, so you can deal with them even if they are present in different marketsâ€”for example, USDT-BTC, USDT-ETH, BTC-ETH, etc.

The StepGrid controller supports USDT, BUSD, USDC, USD, EUR, BTC, ETH, BNB, and you can compound your â€œ**Trading Limit**,â€ keep reserve or increase the (TL) trading limit. This method also includes Stop Loss as a risk management choice.

All that and much more is available for you to download for FREE from the Gunthy Marketplace. [Click here to Download your copy of the StepGrid strategy controller](https://marketplace.gunthy.io/product/stepgrid-controller-autonomous-spot-trading/).

**Pointers You Should Keep in Mind when using this Gunbot Strategy**:

* Due to how compounding operates, it is difficult for the bot to combine trades with different limits on the same account.
* Be aware that manual trading on the same account with the same base currency can lead your strategy to behave unusually.
* Remember that this strategy works with Stop Loss, so when a stop-loss is used in this setup, it can sometimes lead to lost sell orders.
* Note that trading behavior might become unpredictable in shallow volume markets. To keep the trading behavior in check, use the â€œforce step sizeâ€ option using the stepGrid strategy.
* The included AutoConfig jobs must handle all pairs on the exchange.

**Extra Warning Notes**:

This is an excellent opportunity for a financial lesson! ğŸ™‚ Always keep some of your funds in reserve. It is good to be wise and prepared for any future market surprises.

**Hereâ€™s a tip**: Try to keep the number of pairs you buy to a minimum. This way, your bot will process your pairs faster and more frequently.

Donâ€™t freak out if you see a lot of pairs being added to the strategy. This is OK because Gunbot wonâ€™t trade all of them, donâ€™t worry, thatâ€™s how the autoconfig controller is expected to behave.

## Gunbot stepGridHedge Strategy

The Gunbot Step Grid Hedge strategy is still in its beta testing phase and is currently available to [trade on the futures market](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-futures-crypto-trading-guide/). To use the stepGrid Hedge strategy, you need to be running the Gunbot â€œv23.1.2 betaâ€ build or newer.

*StepGridHedge* Logic and Expected Behavior

The (**SGH**) strategy uses the same order triggers as stepGrid does on spot markets but differently.

Imagine the stepGrid strategy trading futures longs. When it encounters a sell step below the average entry price (which would cause a loss on the long side), it will execute a trade on the short side.

The same principle works on basically any situation the step Grid can encounter. It fires an order in the direction that is either profitable or will not incur a loss by firing the order.

Additionally, some â€œnot configurableâ€ methods prevent [DCA](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-dca-dollar-cost-averaging-overview/) orders from trying not to accumulate too much too fast.

The **stepGridhedge** strategy gets more profitable once it has time to accumulate positions bigger than a number of your Trading Limit (TL), which it will close in many parts â€“ ever further away from your average entry.

Long periods of sideways trading are the main enemy of this strategy because there is a risk of accumulating too much around similar prices.

**How to configure the trading pairs on the Gunbot stepGridHedge strategy**

The short pair is only there to collect data and visualize trades. The settings for the â€œshortâ€ trading pair are to make sure it never trades.

The long pair does the actual trading on both sides. Always make sure to have the short pair before the long trading pair.

There is no GUI strategy editor yet for the stepGridHedge strategy, so start by setting both the short and long pair on your config.js file, as you see in the picture below.

As you see in the image above, the settings are based on a 500 USDT test wallet with no other pairs active. So use that as a reference so you can adjust your settings based on your wallet size and preferences.

â€œ**TRADING_LIMIT**â€œ: Add a numeric value in USDT. This TL is the regular amount per initial or DCA order. The first few orders can sometimes use 1.5x or 2x this amount.

â€œ**MAX_BUY_COUNT**â€œ: This is the maximum position size (measured in TL) per side. Bot wonâ€™t add more to the position if this threshold is reached.

â€œ**MAX_UNHEDGED**â€œ: This is the maximum unhedged position size, the imbalance between long and short. For example, if the â€œlongâ€ is 20x your TL and the short is 5x your TL, there is a 15x TL (Trading Limit) unhedged. Bot wonâ€™t add more to the position if this threshold is reached.

â€œ**STOP_AFTER_CLOSE_LONG**â€œ: Set to true, but it doesnâ€™t open a new long after closing one.

â€œ**STOP_AFTER_CLOSE_SHORT**â€œ: Set to true, but it doesnâ€™t open a new short after closing one.

Other stepGrid specific settings like manual step size also work precisely the same way as on the stepGrid strategy for spot trading.

Thereâ€™s one caution with order sizes on Bybit, the min order size is rather big and makes it hard to estimate how much TL a position currently is.

For example, if ETH is trading at $3000 and the minimum order size is 0.01 ETH in value, then a trading limit of $31 or $35 will both result in buying 0.01 ETH.

[Cryptocurrency trading bots are valuable tools](https://cryptodroi.com/) that provide investors with the opportunity to make trades without having to monitor markets and perform other tasks.

This robot-generated automated process is designed to take care of your crypto trading tasks with high accuracy and less influence from human psychology.

Crypto trading bots can help [reduce your risk](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-money-management-crypto-trading-secrets/) by adhering mathematically to a strategy, making decisions based on fact, not feelings.

As a result, High-frequency and institutional traders widely use [crypto trading bots](https://cryptodroi.medium.com/crypto-trading-bots-ultimate-guide-2021-ea883d2419f) for tasks that would be almost impossible to sustain otherwise.

A cryptocurrency trading bot responds to an algorithm designed by the developer. You choose the trading strategy, and the indicators used to generate â€œ**BUY**â€ and â€œ**SELL**â€ signals. The bot makes trades based on the requirements you set.

Customization is one of the essential elements of any successful trading. A good trading bot should allow you to [customize the settings of your trading strategy](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-v22-released-ultimate-strategy-setup-guide/) as much as possible and be configured with a simple, user-friendly graphical interface.

So, you are probably asking yourself why traders use automated bots in such a volatile market as cryptocurrency trading?

Well, here are seven benefits of relying on automated crypto tradingâ€¦

### Crypto Trading Bots Facilitate Your Access to the Trading Industry.

Before jumping into the crypto field, it is important to note that some people make money by â€œ**manually**â€ trading digital currencies. This is exhausting.

For some time now, cryptocurrency has been a gift for experienced traders, while newcomers encounter setbacks after setbacks as they cut through the steep learning curve.

Without a friendly system, you will need preparation and constant research before investing in this space.

> You have to learn the ins and outs of the volatile crypto market.

So, a reliable automated trading system will provide an easier stepping stone for you. It will help you minimize your risks as you learn the principles and strategies of crypto trading.

Automated crypto trading is based on the idea of letting a bot or software, which has been given specific instructions or trading strategy, monitor opportunities and market conditions and execute the commands preset by you.

While it is not entirely error-free, [automated crypto trading](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot-best-day-traders-crypto-trading-software/) enables newbie traders to monitor successful tradersâ€™ strategies to craft their trading plans.

Besides trading on your behalf, the system also allows you to take advantage of several intuitive features as you learn the basics to minimize grave mistakes, which could cost your entire wallet.

### Crypto Trading Bots Provide a Degree of Efficiency in Trading.

It is inefficient and tough for us to learn how to trade and decide to enter or exit a trade while analyzing trends in the constantly changing crypto space to execute profitable trades.

Even if you are an experienced trader, it will be impossible to work on similar tasks for long hours without losing track or getting mentally exhausted.

Any honest seasoned trader will admit that trading is an exhausting and time-consuming venture.

You have to be fast-thinking, mathematically quick, and have plenty of experience to profit from your trades.

A ***[crypto trading bot](https://cryptodroi.com/gunbot/)*** will relieve you of all the stress of analyzing the market, as it does all the work in the background, even when you are sleeping.

Sure, you will have to do your part in feeding the system with effective strategies and instructions, but most of the work is handled by your trading bot.

Crypto trading bots can make split-second mathematical analyses to enable them to execute a trade.

**Wall Street couldnâ€™t be depending on bots if they were more efficient than humans.**

If you were to make all the right decisions and keep up-to-date with every industry development, you would need to monitor the whole crypto industry nearly on an hour-to-hour basis.

As they say, time is money, so if you waste several hours on a computer only to execute a single order, then you are wasting your precious time.

> Crypto Trading Bots Benefits

### Crypto Trading Bots Work 24/7-365 for You.

This advantage of crypto bots ties to the above discussion. Naturally, you will need to rest as a trader and take care of other issues outside crypto trading.

Since the crypto market is a 24-hour business, some of the most profitable opportunities might show up when you are away from your machine, for example, when you are sleeping.

In such a situation, **Your Crypto Trading Bot** will take up the monitoring and execution of orders when the conditions are favorable and will Start Trading since computers respond to changes within seconds, so an automated system will execute orders immediately as soon as your strategy rules are met.

### Crypto Trading Bots are Emotionless Traders.

Traders often suffer from emotional baggage when they engage their thoughts in the trading process.

They often question a trade or hesitate before making a move, which can be exhausting.

Automated trading bots relieve you of this problem, as all the orders are completed automatically.

As mentioned above, all orders are executed according to your strategy and rules. It will refer to what you set in terms of profit targets, stop losses, and buy signals to make decisions.

So, if you tend to overcompensate for losses or are excessively hesitant in pulling the trigger, crypto trading bots will help you regulate your trading.

It will also keep you down from getting a bit cocky when your trades are profitable.

This is one of the crypto trading bots benefits I like the most!

### Crypto Trading Bots Help You to Maintain Discipline.

Besides minimizing emotional inconsistencies, trading bots will only stick to a specified trading strategy.

**Sometimes, this is the kind of discipline that is required in volatile markets.**

As you would expect, discipline is likely to dissipate when emotional factors are involved in a trade.

There is always a tendency to desire a little more profit or fear to take action for fear of making a loss.

> Consistency is key to success in trading.

Even if you believe your trading strategy will guarantee you a huge margin, you might lower your profitability if you overlook the systemâ€™s rules.

An automated trading system will eliminate most of these emotional triggers and stick to a proven pattern.

### Crypto Trading Bots can BackTest Your Strategy Using Historical Data.

This will allow both new and experienced traders to spread their risk over several cryptos and markets while putting limits over losing positions.

An automated crypto trading system will scan profitable opportunities across various cryptos and process orders within milliseconds.
